address: 6365 Stride Avenue, 6370/80 Stride Avenue, 6428/48 Stride Avenue, 7514 Bevan Street
applicant: Mania Hormozi, CLT 0012 Community Society, 220-1651 Commercial Drive, Vancouver, BC, V5L 3Y3
description: Proposed rezoning bylaw amendment to establish development guidelines for non-market housing on the subject site. The subject site measures approximately 0.81 hectares (1.99 acres) and is located within Sub-Area 3 of the Edmonds Town Centre Plan. It forms part of the larger Bevan Lands development site. The proposed development includes two low-rise non-market apartment buildings with up to 108 units. REZ #19-59 established development guidelines for the site, and REZ #20-17 outlines a more detailed form of development for two non-market co-operative buildings with up to 118 units. The CLT was not successful in obtaining BC Housing's Community Housing Fund at that time. CLT and Mosaic expressed continued interest in redeveloping the Bevan Lands, but couldn't reach consensus on agreement terms. The Bevan Lands properties were consolidated to create one larger lot at 6229 Marine Drive. The remaining portion of Bevan Lands is being advanced separately under REZ# 22-04.

rawSummaries.summary:
REZ #20-17 (6365 Stride Avenue and Ptn. of 6370/80, 6428/48 Stride Avenue and 7514 Bevan Street)
The purpose of REZ #20-17 is to permit the development of two non-market rental apartment buildings. This permit is for the addresses 6365 Stride Avenue, a portion of 6370/80 Stride Avenue, 6428/48 Stride Avenue, and 7514 Bevan Street. The permit was discussed in the Manager's Report at the Council meeting on 2020 November 23. The Bylaw associated with this permit, Amendment Bylaw No. 50, 2020, was replaced by Bylaw No. 14613, which received second reading on January 15, 2024.

REZ #20-17 - A Portion of 6229 Marine Drive
Address: A portion of 6229 Marine Drive
Legal: Portion of Lot A, DLs 155A and 171, Group 1 NWD Plan EPP122272
Applicant: Mania Hormozi, CLT 0012 Community Society, 220-1651 Commercial Drive, Vancouver, BC, V5L 3Y3
Current Zoning: CD Comprehensive Development District (based on the RM3r Multiple Family Residential District, and in accordance with the development guidelines prepared by the City under Rezoning Reference #19-59)
Proposed Zoning: Amended CD Comprehensive Development District (based on the RM2 Multiple Family Residential District and RM2r Multiple Family Residential District, the Edmonds Town Centre Plan as guidelines, and in accordance with the revised development guidelines provided in Appendix A of the Rezoning Bylaw)
Recommendations: 1. Repeal and abandon Burnaby Zoning Bylaw 1965, Amendment Bylaw No. 50, 2020 (Bylaw No. 14250) contingent upon granting of Second Reading of new Rezoning Bylaw for REZ #20-17. 2. Amend Burnaby Zoning Bylaw 1965, Amendment Bylaw No. 35, 2023 (Bylaw No. 14613) in accordance with Section 3.0 and Attachment 2 of the report and advance to Second Reading and future Public Hearing. 3. Authorize necessary Statutory Rights of Way over the subject site for third-party utility providers. 4. Send a copy of the report to BC Housing. 5. Establish prerequisites to completion of rezoning: submission of a suitable plan of development, completion of a Subdivision Plan, and granting of necessary Section 219 Covenants and Statutory Rights of Way.
Chief Administrative Officer's Comments: Concurs with the recommendation of the General Manager Planning and Development.
Executive Summary: Proposed rezoning bylaw amendment aims to establish development guidelines for non-market housing on the subject site.
Policy Section: Proposed rezoning application is consistent with various policies and plans adopted by Council.
Background: - Subject site measures approximately 0.81 hectares and is located within Sub-Area 3 of the Edmonds Town Centre Plan. - Subject site, together with a larger site to the southwest, forms the "Bevan Lands" development site. - Council advanced a program in 2019 for non-market housing development on City-owned sites, including the subject site (REZ# 19-59). - Public Hearing report for the subject site (REZ# 20-17) submitted in 2020 outlined detailed development for non-market co-operative buildings. - CLT was not successful in obtaining BC Housing's Community Housing Fund at that time. - BC Housing announced funding for the subject site in 2023. - Council referred a report back to staff to explore opportunities for additional density and non-market housing units on the subject site. - Revised report provides updated CD Guidelines to facilitate potential for additional units on the subject site. - City staff are exploring the option of adding additional units to the proposed development in coordination with BC Housing and CLT. - Finalized density and request for City housing grant will be subject of future Council report.

REZ #20-17 - A Portion of 6229 Marine Drive
Address: A portion of 6229 Marine Drive
Legal: Portion of Lot A, DLs 155A and 171, Group 1 NWD Plan EPP122272
Applicant: Mania Hormozi, CLT 0012 Community Society, 220-1651 Commercial Drive, Vancouver, BC, V5L 3Y3
Current Zoning: CD Comprehensive Development District (based on the RM3r Multiple Family Residential District, and in accordance with the development guidelines prepared by the City under REZ #19-59)
Proposed Zoning: Amended CD Comprehensive Development District (based on the RM2 Multiple Family Residential District and RM2r Multiple Family Residential District, the Edmonds Town Centre Plan as guidelines, and in accordance with the revised development guidelines provided in Appendix A of the Rezoning Bylaw)
Recommendations: 1. Prepare a new Rezoning Bylaw for REZ #20-17 and advance it to First Reading and a Public Hearing at a future date of Council 2. Abandon the current in-stream Rezoning Bylaw for REZ #20-17, Burnaby Zoning Bylaw 1965, Amendment Bylaw No. 50 - 2020 (Bylaw No. 14250), contingent upon the granting by Council of Second Reading of the new Rezoning Bylaw for REZ #20-17 3. Authorize the granting and execution of necessary Statutory Rights of Way over the subject site in favor of third-party utility providers 4. Send a copy of this report to BC Housing 5. Establish prerequisites to the completion of the rezoning: a) Submission of a suitable plan of development b) Completion of a Subdivision Plan c) Granting of any necessary Section 219 Covenants and Statutory Rights of Way
Chief Administrative Officer's Comments: Concur with the recommendation of the General Manager Planning and Development
Executive Summary: Proposed rezoning bylaw amendment to establish development guidelines for non-market housing on the subject site
Policy Section: Consistent with various policies and plans adopted by Council
Background: - Subject site measures approximately 0.81 hectares (1.99 acres) and is located within Sub-Area 3 of the Edmonds Town Centre Plan - Forms part of the larger Bevan Lands development site - Proposed development includes two low-rise non-market apartment buildings with up to 108 units - REZ #19-59 established development guidelines for the site - REZ #20-17 outlines a more detailed form of development for two non-market co-operative buildings with up to 118 units - CLT was not successful in obtaining BC Housing's Community Housing Fund at that time - CLT and Mosaic expressed continued interest in redeveloping the Bevan Lands, but couldn't reach consensus on agreement terms - Bevan Lands properties consolidated to create one larger lot at 6229 Marine Drive - Remaining portion of Bevan Lands being advanced separately under REZ# 22-04

description: The application is for the rezoning of 1002-1052 Seymour Street and 550 Nelson Street from Downtown District (DD) to CD-1 (Comprehensive Development) District. The purpose is to increase density and change the use to commercial in a mixed-use building. The proposal aligns with the Granville Street Planning Program and the Granville Street Interim Rezoning Policy. The staff recommend referring the application to a public hearing with the recommendation to approve it in principle, subject to conditions.

description: This report recommends an amendment to the Zoning and Development By-law from RT-2 (Residential) District to RR-2B (Residential Rental) District, for the site located at 2726-2734 West 16th Avenue. The amendment would allow for a five-storey rental building in accordance with the Secured Rental Policy. An estimated total of 35 secured rental units would be delivered through this application.

The amendment would allow for a five-storey rental building in accordance with the Secured Rental Policy. An estimated total of 35 secured rental units would be delivered through this application. description: The application is for the rezoning of 6095 Fraser Street from C-2 (Commercial) District to CD-1 (Comprehensive Development) District. The proposal is for a seven-storey mixed-use building with two storeys of commercial space and 36 units of secured market rental housing under the Secured Rental Policy (SRP). The development meets the intent of the Secured Rental Policy and is recommended to be referred to a Public Hearing, with the recommendation of the General Manager of Planning, Urban Design and Sustainability to approve it in principle, subject to the Public Hearing and conditions contained in Appendix B.

rawSummaries.summary:
CD-1 Rezoning: 6095 Fraser Street
This report evaluates an application to rezone 6095 Fraser Street from C-2 (Commercial) District to CD-1 (Comprehensive Development) District. The proposal is to permit a seven-storey mixed-use building that includes two storeys of commercial space and 36 units of secured market rental housing under the Secured Rental Policy (SRP). The proposed use and form of development meets the intent of the Secured Rental Policy, subject to design development and other conditions in Appendix B. Staff recommend that the application be referred to a Public Hearing, with the recommendation of the General Manager of Planning, Urban Design and Sustainability to approve it in principle, subject to the Public Hearing, and conditions contained in Appendix B.

description: The rezoning of 1190 Burrard Street was approved in principle after a Public Hearing on July 6, 2021. The owner of the lands entered into a Housing Agreement with the City, as approved under By-law No. 13339. Subsequently, a new Housing Agreement was entered into under By-law No. 13837, and the New Housing Agreement was registered at the Land Title Office under registration No. CB1065183-CB1065186. The Original Housing Agreement was replaced by the New Housing Agreement, and By-law No. 13339 should be repealed to discharge the Original Housing Agreement at the Land Title Office. The rezoning by-law was enacted on July 20, 2022, under By-law No. 13489.

1190 Burrard Street
After a public hearing on July 6, 2021, Council approved in principle the land owner’s application to rezone the property from Downtown District (DD) to CD-1 (Comprehensive Development) District. The Housing Agreement was approved by Council under By-law No. 13339 and registered on title to the development lands under land title registration numbers CB56687 to CB56690. A new Housing Agreement was prepared due to requested amendments by the British Columbia Housing Management Commission. The new Housing Agreement was accepted and executed by the applicant, and the City now seeks enactment of a By-law to authorize such Housing Agreement and to authorize the City to enter into the Housing Agreement with the land owner. Upon registration of this new Housing Agreement on title to the development lands, the City will seek a repeal of By-law No. 13339 to effect a discharge of the Original Housing Agreement. Director of Legal Services October 31, 2023

description: A rezoning of 441-475 West 42nd Avenue was approved in principle after a Public Hearing on January 19, 2021. Subsequently, a New Housing Agreement was entered into as authorized under By-law No. 13835, pursuant to the amendments made to the Moderate Income Rental Housing Pilot Program Rezoning Policy, the Vancouver Development Cost Levy By-law (No. 9755) and the amendments to the Housing Condition of this rezoning. The New Housing Agreement was registered at the Land Title Office under registration No. CB1005706-CB1005708. The Original Housing Agreement was replaced by the New Housing Agreement and By-law No. 13425 authorizing the Original Housing Agreement will be repealed, following which, the Original Housing Agreement will be discharged at the Land Title Office.

3279-3297 Vanness Avenue
After a public hearing on October 1, 2019, Council approved in principle the land owner’s application to rezone the property from CD-1 District (225) to a new CD-1 (Comprehensive Development) District. The Housing Agreement was approved by Council under By-law No. 13170 and registered on title to the development lands under land title registration number CA9495466. British Columbia Housing Management Commission, as mortgagee, has requested certain amendments to the Housing Agreement, that were satisfactory to the General Manager of Planning, Urban Design and Sustainability and the Director of Legal Services and accordingly a new Housing Agreement was prepared. The new Housing Agreement was accepted and executed by the applicant, and the City now seeks enactment of a By-law as contemplated by section 565.2 of the Vancouver Charter, to authorize such Housing Agreement and to authorize the City to enter into the Housing Agreement with the land owner. Upon registration of this new Housing Agreement on title to the development lands, the City will seek a repeal of By-law No. 13170 to effect a discharge of the Original Housing Agreement. Director of Legal Services October 31, 2023

description: Terra 8120 Number 1 Road Limited Partnership has applied for the rezoning of 8120 and 8140 No. 1 Road from the “Single Detached (RS1/E)” zone to the “Low Density Townhouses (RTL4)” zone. The purpose is to develop nine townhouse units with vehicle access from No. 1 Road. Existing dwellings on the site will be demolished. Surrounding development includes single-family dwellings and townhouses. The redevelopment proposal is consistent with the Official Community Plan and Arterial Road Land Use Policy. Although the frontage is less than the required 50 m, staff support the application due to efforts made to acquire adjacent properties and the submission of a preliminary concept plan for future redevelopment. A Statutory Right-of-Way agreement must be registered to secure shared access to adjacent properties. Staff recommendation is to introduce and give first reading to Richmond Zoning Bylaw 8500, Amendment Bylaw 10498 for the rezoning.

rawSummaries.summary:
RZ 21-945869
Terra 8120 Number 1 Road Limited Partnership has applied to rezone 8120 and 8140 No. 1 Road from the “Single Detached (RS1/E)” zone to the “Low Density Townhouses (RTL4)” zone. The proposal is to develop nine townhouse units, with vehicle access from No. 1 Road. The subject site consists of two lots located on the east side of No. 1 Road, between Blundell Road and Coldfall Road. The proposed development consists of nine townhouse units on a site that would be approximately 1,801.3 m2 (19,389 ft2) in area after the required 0.91 m wide road dedication along No. 1 Road. The proposed site layout consists of one three-storey building along the west side of the site facing No. 1 Road, two two-storey duplex buildings along the east side of the site along the interface with existing single-family housing fronting Corless Place, and an internal drive-aisle that runs north-south between the front and rear buildings. All units have an east-west orientation, with the main unit entries facing either No. 1 Road or the internal drive-aisle. Private outdoor space for the units fronting No. 1 Road is proposed primarily in the form of front yards at ground level with secondary decks on the upper levels facing either No. 1 Road or the internal drive-aisle. Private outdoor space for the two-storey units is proposed primarily in the form of rear yards. The proposal is for nine strata-titled townhouse units. Vehicle access to the site is proposed off No. 1 Road. Pedestrian access to the street-fronting units will be provided via individual pathways. On-site parking will be provided within each unit's garage. Two visitor surface parking spaces will be provided off the internal drive-aisle. Resident and visitor bike parking will be provided. A Certified Arborist's Report has been submitted, identifying trees on-site and off-site. Some trees on-site are in poor condition and should be removed and replaced. Trees on neighboring properties will be retained and protected. Tree protection measures will be implemented during the development stage. Variance requests are being sought to reduce the minimum required lot width and allow six small vehicle parking spaces. Staff is supportive of the variance requests.

RZ 21-945869 - 8120 and 8140 No. 1 Road
Terra 8120 Number 1 Road Limited Partnership has applied for the rezoning of 8120 and 8140 No. 1 Road from the “Single Detached (RS1/E)” zone to the “Low Density Townhouses (RTL4)” zone. The purpose is to develop nine townhouse units with vehicle access from No. 1 Road. Existing dwellings on the site will be demolished. Surrounding development includes single-family dwellings and townhouses. The redevelopment proposal is consistent with the Official Community Plan and Arterial Road Land Use Policy. Although the frontage is less than the required 50 m, staff support the application due to efforts made to acquire adjacent properties and the submission of a preliminary concept plan for future redevelopment. A Statutory Right-of-Way agreement must be registered to secure shared access to adjacent properties. Staff recommendation is to introduce and give first reading to Richmond Zoning Bylaw 8500, Amendment Bylaw 10498 for the rezoning.

description: Navreet Gill has applied on behalf of the property owners, 1303287 B.C. Ltd. (Balraj Singh Sanghera and Rajbir Kaur Chatha), to rezone 11831/11833 Seabrook Crescent from the “Single Detached (RS1/E)” zone to the “Single Detached (RS2/B)” zone in order to permit the property to be subdivided into two single-family lots, each with vehicle access from Seabrook Crescent. The subject site contains an existing un-stratified non-conforming duplex (two-unit dwelling), which will be demolished prior to subdivision. Both dwelling units are currently tenant occupied and do not contain any secondary suites. The proposed rezoning and subdivision complies with Section 2.3.7 and would result in the creation of two single-family lots being 444.9 m2 and 450.2 m2 in area. Preliminary confirmation has been received from MOTI indicating that they have no objections to the proposed redevelopment. Final approval from MOTI is required prior to final adoption of the rezoning bylaw. Registration of a flood indemnity covenant on Title is required prior to final adoption of the rezoning bylaw. A rezoning sign has been installed on the subject property. Staff have not received any comments from the public about the rezoning application in response to the placement of the rezoning sign on the property. Should the Planning Committee endorse this application and Council grant first reading to the rezoning bylaw, the bylaw will be forwarded to a Public Hearing, where any area resident or interested party will have an opportunity to comment. Public notification for the Public Hearing will be provided as per the Local Government Act and the City’s Zoning Bylaw 8500.

description: The application is for the rezoning of 10511 Lassam Road from the 'Single Detached RS1/E' Zone to the 'Single Detached (RS2/B)' Zone. Onyx Premier Homes Ltd. (Directors: Amar Gill and Jasdeep Uppal) have applied to the City of Richmond for permission to rezone the property to permit the creation of two single-family lots with access from Lassam Road. The proposed subdivision will consist of two lots, each approximately 12.6 m wide and 575 m² in area, conforming to the RS2/B zone. The proposed redevelopment also includes compliance with the Richmond Flood Plain Designation and Protection Bylaw 8204, as well as adherence to the City's Early Public Notification Policy No. 1316. The redevelopment will involve the expansion and widening of the existing 3 m wide Statutory Right-of-Way (SRW) for City sanitary service, with no building encroachment permitted. Vehicular access for the new lots will be from Lassam Road in accordance with the Residential Lot (Vehicular) Access Regulation Bylaw 7222.

rawSummaries.summary:
RZ 22-011080 at 10511 Lassam Road
Onyx Premier Homes Ltd. has applied to rezone 10511 Lassam Road from the 'Single Detached (RS1/E)' zone to the 'Single Detached (RS2/B)' zone. The purpose is to create two single-family lots with access from Lassam Road. The proposed lots comply with the Lot Size Policy and the proposed redevelopment must meet the requirements of the Richmond Flood Plain Designation and Protection Bylaw 8204. The proposed redevelopment will rezone and subdivide the existing single-family lot into two new single-family lots with access from Lassam Road. The rezoning and subdivision align with the lot fabric and vehicular access along Lassam Road. Vehicular access to the proposed lots will be from Lassam Road.

RZ 22-011080
Application by Gurjit Pooni for Rezoning at 10511 Lassam Road from the "Single Detached RS1/E" Zone to the "Single Detached (RS2/B)" Zone. Onyx Premier Homes Ltd. (Directors: Amar Gill and Jasdeep Uppal) have applied to the City of Richmond for permission to rezone 10511 Lassam Road from the "Single Detached (RS1/E)" zone to the "Single Detached (RS2/B)" zone, to permit the property to be subdivided to create two single-family lots with access from Lassam Road. A map and aerial photograph showing the location of the subject site is included in Attachment 1. The proposed subdivision is provided in Attachment 2. The subject property is located in the Steveston planning area and is designated as "Neighbourhood Residential" in the Official Community Plan (OCP). The property is designated for "Single Family" use in the Steveston Area Plan. The proposed rezoning and subdivision are consistent with these designations. The subject property is located within the area covered by Lot Size Policy 5420, adopted by City Council in 1989, and subsequently amended by Council on August 7, 1992, and on August 21, 1995 (Attachment 4). The Policy permits properties along Lassam Road to be rezoned and subdivided in accordance with the provisions of the "Single Detached (RS2/B)" zone (minimum 12 m wide lots). Each proposed lot at the subject site will be approximately 12.6 m (41 ft.) wide and approximately 575 m² (6,189.25 ft²) in area which conforms to the RS2/B zone. The proposed rezoning complies with the Lot Size Policy. The proposed redevelopment must meet the requirements of the Richmond Flood Plain Designation and Protection Bylaw 8204. Registration of a flood indemnity covenant on Title is required prior to final adoption of the rezoning bylaw. In accordance with the City's Early Public Notification Policy No. 1316, a notice of the development proposal was provided to residents within 100 metres of the subject site. In addition, a rezoning sign has been installed on the subject property. Staff have not received any comments from the public about the rezoning application in response to the early public notification or placement of the rezoning sign on the property. Should the Planning Committee endorse this application and Council grant first reading to the rezoning bylaw, the bylaw will be forwarded to a Public Hearing, where any area resident or interested party will have an opportunity to comment. Public notification for the Public Hearing will be provided as per the Local Government Act and the City's Zoning Bylaw 8500. This redevelopment proposes to rezone and subdivide an existing single-family lot into two new single-family lots with vehicular access for both new lots off Lassam Road. This rezoning and subdivision is consistent with the emerging lot fabric and vehicular access along Lassam Road. There is an existing 3 m wide Statutory Right-of-Way (SRW) for City sanitary service that covers a small portion of the property in the southwest corner which will be expanded and widened northward with utility upgrades. The applicant has been advised that no building encroachment into the SRW is permitted. The subject site currently has vehicular access from a driveway letdown along Lassam Road. In accordance with the Residential Lot (Vehicular) Access Regulation Bylaw 7222, vehicle access to proposed Lot 1 and proposed Lot 2 will be from Lassam Road.

description: Rezoning from RF to CD (based on RM-70) to allow a higher density in the 'Multiple Residential' designation. description: The development proposal includes an OCP Amendment from 'Commercial' to 'Multiple Residential', NCP Amendment from 'High Rise Residential' and 'High Rise Mixed Use' to 'Low to Mid Rise Residential', and Rezoning from C-35 to CD (based on RM-70). The proposed development consists of two, 6-storey apartment buildings with approximately 192 dwelling units and underground parking in Guildford. A Bylaw is to be introduced to amend the Official Community Plan (OCP) Figure 3: General Land Use Designations for the subject site from 'Commercial' to 'Multiple Residential', and a date for Public Hearing be set. A Bylaw is also to be introduced to amend the OCP Figure 42: Major Employment Areas for the subject site by removing the 'Commercial' designation for the subject site, and a date for Public Hearing be set. Council is to determine the opportunities for consultation with persons, organizations and authorities that are considered to be affected by the proposed amendment to the OCP, as described in the Report, to be appropriate to meet the requirement of Section 475 of the Local Government Act. Additionally, a Bylaw is to be introduced to rezone the subject site from 'Downtown Commercial Zone (C-35)' to 'Comprehensive Development Zone (CD)', and a date be set for Public Hearing. Council is also to authorize staff to draft Development Permit No. 7923-0200-00 generally in accordance with the attached drawings (Appendix I). Finally, Council is to pass a resolution to amend the Guildford Plan to redesignate the subject site from 'High Rise Residential' and 'High Rise Mixed-Use' to 'Low to Mid Rise Residential' when the project is considered for final adoption (Appendix VII).

REZ #21-16 - 5292 and 5318 Kingsway
A rezoning application has been received for the construction of mixed-use development above underground parking at 5292 and 5318 Kingsway. The proposal includes two six-storey mixed-use buildings with commercial uses at grade and 85 residential units above (75 strata units and ten non-market rental units). The purpose of this report is to provide information on the proposal and recommend bringing the Rezoning Bylaw forward for First Reading and a future Public Hearing. The proposed rezoning application is consistent with various policies and plans adopted by Council. The subject development site is located along Kingsway and Grimmer Street, designated for medium density mixed-use development in the Royal Oak Community Plan. The applicant has elected to proceed with the rezoning proposal despite potential future updates to the Community Plan. Staff recommend proceeding with the rezoning application concurrent with the Community Plan update. description: A rezoning application has been received for the construction of a high-density mixed-tenure residential development atop a commercial/retail podium and underground parking at 4141 Lougheed Highway. The proposed zoning is to change from M1 Manufacturing District to CD Comprehensive Development District, based on RM5s Multiple Family Residential District, RM5r Multiple Family Residential District, C3 General Commercial District, and the Brentwood Town Centre Development Plan as guidelines. The proposed development plan includes two high-rise residential apartment buildings on top of a commercial/retail podium and underground parking. Vehicle access to the site is currently through 1934 Gilmore Avenue, and access to the development is proposed via a temporary street within the easement. Vehicular access will also be provided from and to the east once 4199 Lougheed Highway is redeveloped. Pedestrian access is provided from both Lougheed Highway and the future east-west street along the northern portion of the site. The development will be constructed in a single phase. The development concept involves demolishing the existing warehouse and surface parking and constructing a 62-storey residential strata building (Building A) in the northeast corner of the lot, and a 54-storey residential market and non-market rental building (Building B) in the southwest corner of the lot. Both buildings sit atop a 10-storey commercial podium, which includes a hotel with supporting amenities and ground-oriented retail units. The commercial podium allows for flexibility in occupancy, allowing the floor space to be utilized for offices or other employment generating uses as permitted within the C3 District.

rawSummaries.summary:
REZ #22-06
Address: 4141 Lougheed Highway
Legal: Lot 21 District Lot 119 Group 1 New Westminster District Plan 25896
Applicant: Adam Nour, Millennium Properties Ltd.
Current Zoning: M1 Manufacturing District
Proposed Zoning: CD Comprehensive Development District based on RM5s Multiple Family Residential District, RM5r Multiple Family Residential District, C3 General Commercial District, and the Brentwood Town Centre Development Plan as guidelines, and in accordance with the development plan entitled '4141 Lougheed Hwy Mixed Use Development' prepared by FaulknerBrowns Architects.
Recommendations:
1. Prepare a Rezoning Bylaw for REZ #22-06 and advance it to First Reading and a Public Hearing at a future date.
2. Authorize the introduction of a Housing Agreement Bylaw according to the terms outlined in Sections 3.4 and 3.12 of the report, contingent upon the granting of Second Reading of the Rezoning Bylaw.
3. Authorize the introduction of a Highway Closure Bylaw according to the terms outlined in Section 3.9 of the report, contingent upon the granting of Second Reading of the Rezoning Bylaw.
4. Approve the sale in principle of City-owned property for inclusion within the subject development site according to the terms outlined in Section 3.9 of the report, and subject to the applicant pursuing the rezoning proposal to completion.
5. Establish prerequisites to the completion of the rezoning, including the submission of a suitable plan of development, deposit of sufficient monies for all necessary services, installation of underground wiring, removal of existing improvements, utilization of an amenity bonus, completion of the Highway Closure Bylaw and sale of City property, consolidation of the project site into one legal parcel, dedication of requisite rights-of-way, granting of necessary statutory rights-of-way, easements, and/or covenants, registration of a Housing Covenant and Housing Agreement, submission of a suitable on-site Stormwater Management System, compliance with the City's Groundwater Management for Multi-Family Development guidelines.
6. Require the posting of a sign on the subject site indicating the rezoning application and public hearing, or until all units are sold, whichever is greater.
Chief Administrative Officer's Comments: The Chief Administrative Officer concurs with the recommendation of the General Manager Planning and Development.
Executive Summary: A rezoning application has been received to permit the construction of a high-density mixed-tenure residential development atop a commercial/retail podium and underground parking. The purpose of this report is to provide Council with information on the proposal and recommend forwarding the rezoning application to a future Public Hearing.
Policy Section: The proposed rezoning application is consistent with various policies and plans adopted by Council.
Background: The subject site is part of the Buchanan West Master Plan and is designated for high-density mixed-use development. The site is currently improved with an older industrial warehouse building and surface parking. The initial rezoning report was received on June 20, 2022.
Development District will use RM5s Multiple Family Residential District, RM5r Multiple Family Residential District, C3 General Commercial District, and Brentwood Town Centre Development Plan as guidelines. Applicant submitted a development plan for two high-rise residential apartment buildings on top of a commercial/retail podium and underground parking. Vehicle access is currently through 1934 Gilmore Avenue and will also be provided from and to the east once 4199 Lougheed Highway is redeveloped. Pedestrian access is available from Lougheed Highway and the future east-west street on the site's northern portion. The development will be constructed in a single phase. It involves demolishing the existing warehouse and surface parking and constructing a 62-storey residential strata building (Building A) in the northeast corner and a 54-storey residential market and non-market rental building (Building B) in the southwest corner. Both buildings sit on a 10-storey commercial podium that includes a hotel(s) with amenities and retail units. The commercial podium can be used for offices or other employment generating uses if the hotel market softens in the future.

REZ #22-06 - 4141 Lougheed Highway

The proposed zoning is to change from M1 Manufacturing District to CD Comprehensive Development District, based on RM5s Multiple Family Residential District, RM5r Multiple Family Residential District, C3 General Commercial District, and the Brentwood Town Centre Development Plan as guidelines. The proposed development plan includes two high-rise residential apartment buildings on top of a commercial/retail podium and underground parking. Vehicle access to the site is currently through 1934 Gilmore Avenue, and access to the development is proposed via a temporary street within the easement. Vehicular access will also be provided from and to the east once 4199 Lougheed Highway is redeveloped. Pedestrian access is provided from both Lougheed Highway and the future east-west street along the northern portion of the site. The development will be constructed in a single phase. The development concept involves demolishing the existing warehouse and surface parking and constructing a 62-storey residential strata building (Building A) in the northeast corner of the lot, and a 54-storey residential market and non-market rental building (Building B) in the southwest corner of the lot. Both buildings sit atop a 10-storey commercial podium, which includes a hotel with supporting amenities and ground-oriented retail units. The commercial podium allows for flexibility in occupancy, allowing the floor space to be utilized for offices or other employment generating uses as permitted within the C3 District.

description: The rezoning application is for the construction of a high-rise residential building atop a residential and commercial podium with street-fronting commercial space and underground parking at 2211 and 2271 Rosser Avenue. The proposed development is consistent with various policies and plans adopted by Council, including the Regional Context Statement, Corporate Strategic Plan, Official Community Plan, Brentwood Town Centre Development Plan, Economic Development Strategy, Social Sustainability Strategy, Environmental Sustainability Strategy, Climate Action Framework, Transportation Plan, Home Strategy, and Rental Use Zoning Policy. The subject site is approximately 4,333 m2 (46,640 sq. ft.) and consists of two properties on Rosser Avenue. The site also includes a City lane that will be closed according to the Brentwood Town Centre Development Plan. Currently, the site has older industrial units and a residential sales centre. The site is designated for medium to high-density mixed-use development, including the possibility of a hotel. The addition of a hotel is supported by staff as it will enhance the community by providing an active destination. The hotel will be located at 2211 Rosser Avenue. Under the 's' zoning category, new developments are expected to provide community benefits, sustainable redevelopment, public art, high-quality urban design, and superior architectural expression. The applicant has submitted a suitable plan of development for a Public Hearing.

rawSummaries.summary:

A rezoning application, REZ #22-08, has been received for the construction of a high-rise residential building with commercial space and underground parking at 2211 and 2271 Rosser Avenue. The site is approximately 4,333 m2 in size and currently improved with industrial units and a residential sales centre. It is designated for medium to high-density development under the Brentwood Town Centre Development Plan. The proposed high-density mixed-use development will be implemented using the RM4, RM4s, RM4r, and C9 Districts as guidelines. The addition of the C3 District designation is supported by staff to allow for the development of a hotel on the site, limited to hotel use and not allowing for additional density beyond what is necessary for the hotel. The applicant has submitted a suitable plan of development that meets the standards for new developments under the 's' zoning category, including community benefits, sustainable redevelopment approach, public realm improvements, high-quality urban design, and superior architectural expression. The recommendation is to bring the Rezoning Bylaw forward for First Reading and to forward the application to a future Public Hearing.

description: A rezoning application has been received for 5166 Halifax Street to permit the construction of two mid-rise residential buildings with underground parking. The proposed rezoning application is consistent with various policies and plans adopted by Council. The subject site is currently improved with a residential rental apartment building and is designated for medium-density multiple-family residential development. The proposed plan includes two six-storey midrise, mixed-tenure rental residential buildings with an internal courtyard, amenity spaces, and underground parking. Vehicular access to the site is proposed from Ridgelawn Drive. The development concept involves demolishing an older rental residential building with 87 dwelling units and replacing it with two buildings totaling 257 rental residential dwelling units. The proposed development offers a modern aesthetic, inclusive design, street-level unit access, shared amenity spaces, and a well-programmed communal courtyard. It includes a range of housing types from studios and one-bedroom units to three-bedroom and den units as well as three-bedroom townhouses. Overall, the proposal demonstrates high-quality urban design and architectural expression in terms of the building's siting, massing, pedestrian orientation, and materiality. The recommendation is to bring the Rezoning Bylaw forward for First Reading and forward the rezoning application to a future Public Hearing.

rawSummaries.summary:
REZ #22-09 - 5166 Halifax Street
Rezoning application received for the construction of two mid-rise residential buildings with underground parking at 5166 Halifax Street. The proposed development plan includes two six-storey midrise, mixed-tenure rental residential buildings with an internal courtyard, amenity spaces, and underground parking. The demolition of the existing site improvements and replacement with two buildings totaling 257 rental residential dwelling units is recommended. The proposed development offers modern aesthetic, inclusive design, street-level unit access, shared amenity spaces, and communal courtyard. It also provides a range of housing types including studios, one-bedroom units, and family-oriented units such as three-bedroom and den units and three-bedroom townhouses. The subject proposal exemplifies high quality urban design and architectural expression related to building's siting, massing, pedestrian orientation, and materiality. The recommendations include authorizing the introduction of a Housing Agreement Bylaw, a Highway Closure Bylaw, approving the sale of City-owned property for inclusion within the development site, preparing and advancing a Rezoning Bylaw for REZ #22-09 to First Reading and a Public Hearing, and establishing prerequisites for the completion of the rezoning.

REZ #22-09 - 5166 Halifax Street
A rezoning application has been received for 5166 Halifax Street to permit the construction of two mid-rise residential buildings with underground parking. On August 31, 2022, Council approved a density transfer from the Halifax Site to the Rosser Site. The subject site is currently improved with a residential rental apartment building and is designated for medium-density multiple-family residential development. The proposed plan includes two six-storey midrise, mixed-tenure rental residential buildings with an internal courtyard, amenity spaces, and underground parking. Vehicular access to the site is proposed from Ridgelawn Drive. The development concept involves demolishing an older rental residential building with 87 dwelling units and replacing it with two buildings totaling 257 rental residential dwelling units. The proposed development offers a modern aesthetic, inclusive design, street-level unit access, shared amenity spaces, and a well-programmed communal courtyard. It includes a range of housing types from studios and one-bedroom units to three-bedroom and den units as well as three-bedroom townhouses. Overall, the proposal demonstrates high-quality urban design and architectural expression in terms of the building's siting, massing, pedestrian orientation, and materiality. The recommendation is to bring the Rezoning Bylaw forward for First Reading and forward the rezoning application to a future Public Hearing.

description: A rezoning application has been received to permit the construction of two mid-rise strata apartment buildings atop a commercial podium with underground parking, and a mid-rise market and below-market rental building with underground parking in accordance with Phase 1A of the Burnaby Lake Village Conceptual Master Plan. The Phase 1A of the development includes two mid-rise strata apartment buildings, a commercial podium with underground parking, a mid-rise market and below-market rental building, the Esplanade pedestrian boulevard, the Forest Walk regenerated forest corridor, and two new north-south streets connected by a new east-west street. The Phase 1A site is located on the south side of Lougheed Highway between Bainbridge Avenue and Sperling Avenue. The site is currently occupied by an industrial building with surface parking.

rawSummaries.summary:
REZ #23-06 - Burnaby Lake Village Conceptual Master Plan Phase 1A - Bainbridge Urban Village Community Plan
The proposal is for the construction of two mid-rise strata apartment buildings, a commercial podium, and a mid-rise market and rental building in accordance with Phase 1A of the Burnaby Lake Village Conceptual Master Plan. The subject site comprises Phase 1A of the Master Plan, including two mid-rise strata apartment buildings, a commercial podium, a mid-rise market and rental building, the Esplanade, and the Forest Walk. The Phase 1A site is located on the south side of Lougheed Highway between Bainbridge Avenue and Sperling Avenue. The site is designated for high-density mixed-use development, utilizing the RM5uv-a Multiple Family Residential District, RM5r Multiple Family Residential District, and the C2 Community Commercial District as guidelines. The net Phase 1A site is approximately 9,564 m2 (102,946 sq. ft.) in size and is part of 6800 Lougheed Highway. The current improvement on the site is an industrial building with surface parking.

REZ #23-06
Purpose: Seek Council authorization to forward REZ #23-06 to a future Public Hearing.
Address: Portion of 6800 Lougheed Highway
Legal: Lot 1, Except: Firstly; Part in LMP44883, Secondly; Part in Plan BCP314, Thirdly; Part in Plan BCP1828, Fourthly; Part in Plan BCP22451 District Lot 78 Group 1 New Westminster District Plan 74615
Applicant: Sperling Limited Corporation, 1701-1166 Alberni Street, Vancouver, BC V6E 3Z3, Attention: Sean Callaghan
Current Zoning: M2 General Industrial District and R2 Residential District
Proposed Zoning: CD Comprehensive Development District (based on RM5uv-a Multiple Family Residential District, RM5r Multiple Family Residential District, C2 Community Commercial District, and the Bainbridge Urban Village Community Plan as guidelines, and in accordance with the development plan entitled "Phase 1 Sperling/Saputo/6800, Buildings G & H" prepared by ARCADIS)
Recommendations: 1. Prepare a Rezoning Bylaw for REZ #23-06 and advance it to First Reading and a Public Hearing at a future date. 2. Authorize the introduction of a Housing Agreement Bylaw according to the terms outlined in Section 3.11 of the report titled "REZ #23-06 Burnaby Lake Village Conceptual Master Plan Phase 1A - Bainbridge Urban Village Community Plan" dated October 30, 2023, contingent upon the granting of Second Reading of the Rezoning Bylaw related to the subject site by Council. 3. Establish prerequisites to the completion of the rezoning, including the submission of a suitable plan of development, advancement of the Burnaby Lake Village Conceptual Master Plan (REZ #22-28) to Final Adoption, deposit of sufficient monies for servicing, installation of underground wiring, completion of subdivision, dedication of rights-of-way, granting of necessary statutory rights-of-way, easements, and/or covenants, registration of a Housing Covenant and Housing Agreement, submission of a suitable on-site Stormwater Management System, compliance with Groundwater Management guidelines, submission of geotechnical and groundwater study, execution of an indemnity agreement, submission of a Solid Waste and Recycling Plan, review of on-site loading facilities, provision of enhanced car wash stalls and garbage handling/recycling space, provision of facilities for cyclists, design and provision of units adaptable to persons with disabilities, compliance with sound criteria, compliance with guidelines for underground parking for visitors, submission of a Green Building Plan and Energy Benchmarking, submission of a detailed Comprehensive Sign Plan, submission of a Site Disclosure Statement, and deposit of applicable charges.
Chief Administrative Officer's Comments: Concurs with the recommendation of the General Manager Planning and Development.
Executive Summary: A rezoning application has been received to permit the construction of two mid-rise strata apartment buildings atop a commercial podium with underground parking, and a mid-rise market and below-market rental building with underground parking in accordance with Phase 1A of the Burnaby Lake Village Conceptual Master Plan. Recommend bringing the Rezoning Bylaw forward for First Reading and forwarding it to a future Public Hearing.
Policy Section: The proposed rezoning application is consistent with various policies and plans adopted by Council.
Community Plan. The proposed rezoning would allow for a multi-phased residential and commercial mixed-use development on the site. The Phase 1A of the development includes two mid-rise strata apartment buildings, a commercial podium with underground parking, a mid-rise market and below-market rental building, the Esplanade pedestrian boulevard, the Forest Walk regenerated forest corridor, and two new north-south streets connected by a new east-west street. The Phase 1A site is located on the south side of Lougheed Highway between Bainbridge Avenue and Sperling Avenue. The site is currently occupied by an industrial building with surface parking.

description: The application is to rezone 7300 St. Albans Road from the 'Single Detached (RS1/E)' zone to the 'High Density Townhouses (RTH1)' zone to permit the development of four townhouse units with one secondary suite. The subject site contains an unoccupied single-family dwelling and is surrounded by various types of residential developments. The proposed development complies with the Official Community Plan, City Centre Area Plan, and St. Albans Sub-Area Plan. A legal agreement on Title is required, and the proposed redevelopment must meet the requirements of the Richmond Flood Plain Designation and Protection Bylaw 8204. Public consultation is ongoing, and if the Planning Committee endorses the application, a Public Hearing will be held for further comments from the public.

rawSummaries.summary:
RZ 21-943417
Application by Matthew Cheng for Rezoning at 7300 St. Albans Road from 'Single Detached (RS1/E)' Zone to 'High Density Townhouses (RTH1)' Zone. The proposal is to permit the development of four townhouse units with one secondary suite. The subject site contains an unoccupied single-family dwelling. Surrounding developments include a church to the North, a seven-unit townhouse complex to the South, a 36-unit townhouse complex to the East, and a three-storey apartment to the West. The proposed development is consistent with the Official Community Plan and the St. Albans Sub-Area Plan. The applicant is required to provide a contribution at a rate of $0.34 per buildable square foot for future City Community Planning studies. Public consultation is pending, and a Public Hearing will be held if the rezoning bylaw is granted first reading by the Council.

description: Hari Singh Gill has applied to rezone the property at 3300 Granville Avenue from the “Single Detached (RS1/E)” zone to the “Single Detached (RS2/B)” zone to allow the property to be subdivided into two single-family lots. The site is currently occupied by an existing single-family dwelling, which will be demolished prior to subdivision. The existing single-family dwelling is unoccupied and does not contain a secondary suite. The proposed rezoning and subdivision application is consistent with the Official Community Plan (OCP) land use designation for the subject property, which is “Neighbourhood Residential” (NRES). The subject property falls within Single-Family Lot Size Policy 5447, which allows for the subdivision of the subject property consistent with the R1/B zone. The proposed redevelopment must meet the requirements of the Richmond Flood Plain Designation and Protection Bylaw 8204. The applicant is proposing to rezone the subject site and subdivide into two single-family lots, each with a one bedroom secondary suite. There is an existing Statutory Right-of-Way (SRW) for the City in the rear yard for sanitary sewer services, and the applicant has been advised that encroachment into the SRW is not permitted. Vehicle access is proposed to be from Granville Avenue, and the existing driveway will be removed and new driveways will be constructed through a Servicing Agreement as detailed in the Site Servicing and Frontage Improvements sub-section of this report.

address: 5471 Steveston Highway, 5491/5493 Steveston Highway, 5531 Steveston Highway, 5551 Steveston Highway, 5571 Steveston Highway, 5591 Steveston Highway, 5595 Steveston Highway, 5611/5613 Steveston Highway
description: Interface Architecture Inc., on behalf of Steveston Townhouse Ventures Inc., has applied to rezone multiple properties located at 5471, 5491/5493, 5531, 5551, 5571, 5591, 5595, 5611/5613 Steveston Highway from “Single Detached (RS1/B)” zone, “Single Detached (RS1/E)” zone and “Two-Unit Dwellings (RD1)” zone to the “Medium Density Townhouses (RTM2)” zone. The proposed development includes 30 townhouse units with seven secondary suites and a right-in/right-out vehicle access from Steveston Highway. The total combined frontage of the properties is approximately 151 m along Steveston Highway and a 22 m frontage along Lassam Road. The proposed density is 0.65 floor area ratio (FAR) and the site layout includes 12 two-storey units and 18 three-storey units in ten townhouse clusters. Seven secondary suites and five accessible units are included in this proposal. A Servicing Agreement will be required for the design and construction of frontage beautification works and service connections. The subject site currently contains six single-family homes and four duplex units, and the proposed redevelopment is consistent with the 2041 Official Community Plan (OCP) Land Use Map designation and the Steveston Area Land Use Map designation. The proposal also complies with the Arterial Road Land Use Policy in the City’s 2041 OCP and the Floodplain Management Implementation Strategy. A rezoning sign has been installed on the subject property, and no comments have been received from the public about the rezoning application. If the Planning Committee endorses this application and Council grants first reading to the rezoning bylaw, the bylaw will be forwarded to a Public Hearing.

rawSummaries.summary:
RZ 21-939470
Interface Architecture Inc. has applied to rezone 5471, 5491/5493, 5531, 5551, 5571, 5591, 5595, 5611/5613 Steveston Highway to permit the development of 30 townhouse units with seven secondary suites and a right-in/right-out vehicle access from Steveston Highway. The proposed density is 0.65 floor area ratio (FAR). The site layout includes 12 two-storey units and 18 three-storey units in ten townhouse clusters. Seven secondary suites and five accessible units are included in this proposal. Vehicle access is provided by a single right-in/right-out driveway access to Steveston Highway. The proposal includes consolidating the eight properties into one development parcel, with a total net site area of 6,214 m2. The development consists of 30 townhouses in a mix of two-storey and three-storey units in 10 clusters. The proposal is consistent with the 2041 Official Community Plan (OCP) Land Use Map designation for the subject site, which is “Neighbourhood Residential”. The Steveston Area Land Use Map designation is “Multiple-Family”. The proposal also complies with the Arterial Road Land Use Policy and the Floodplain Management Implementation Strategy. No comments have been received from the public regarding the rezoning application.

description: Pati Yik of Kennon Construction has applied to rezone 10840 and 10860 Bonavista Gate from the “Two-Unit Dwellings (RD1)” zone to the “Single Detached (RS2/C)” zone in order to subdivide the existing duplex lot into two single-family lots, each with vehicle access from Bonavista Gate. The site is currently occupied by an existing duplex dwelling, which will be demolished prior to subdivision. The existing two-family dwelling is owner-occupied and does not contain any secondary suites. The proposed subdivision plan and site plan are provided in Attachment 2. The property is designated as Neighbourhood Residential in the Official Community Plan (OCP), and as Single Family in the Steveston Area Plan. The proposed redevelopment must meet the requirements of the Richmond Flood Plain Designation and Protection Bylaw 8204. A rezoning sign has been installed on the subject property, and staff have not received any comments from the public about the rezoning application. The applicant is proposing to rezone the subject site and subdivide it into two single-family lots, each with a secondary suite, with access from Bonavista Gate. This development proposal is consistent with development in the area. There is a 3.0 m wide Statutory Right-of-Way (SRW) in the backyard along the eastern property line for sanitary sewer utility purposes. Vehicle access is proposed to be from Bonavista Gate for both of the proposed lots. Two parking spaces will be provided for each dwelling unit in the garage.

description: Rezoning from RF to CD (based on RM-70) for the development of a 6-storey apartment building with approximately 102 dwelling units and underground parking on a consolidated site in Guildford. Council determine the opportunities for consultation with persons, organizations and authorities that are considered to be affected by the proposed amendment to the OCP, as described in the Report, to be appropriate to meet the requirement of Section 475 of the Local Government Act. A Bylaw introduced to rezone the subject site from 'Single Family Residential Zone (RF)' to 'Comprehensive Development Zone (CD)'. Council authorize staff to draft Development Permit No. 7921-0230-00 generally in accordance with the attached drawings (Appendix I). Council instruct staff to resolve various issues prior to final adoption such as engineering requirements, urban design issues, landscaping plan, tree preservation, tree replacement, indoor amenity space requirement, demolition of existing buildings and structures, and registration of a Section 219 Restrictive Covenant.

description: The rezoning application is for the lands at 6065-6075 Collingwood Place, with the intention to change the zoning from RS-5 District to RR-2B District. The site consists of two legal parcels with a total area of approximately 2,443.4 sq. m and is currently zoned RS-5 with two single-detached homes. The proposal aligns with the priorities of the Housing Vancouver Strategy and complies with the location criteria under the Secured Rental Policy for five-storey buildings. The recommendation is to refer the application to a Public Hearing and prepare necessary by-laws and amendments to the Subdivision By-law. The application meets the intent of the Secured Rental Policy and is recommended for approval in principle, subject to the Public Hearing and conditions outlined in Appendix B.

rawSummaries.summary:
6065-6075 Collingwood Place rezoning from R1-1 to RR-2B
Applicant: Strand Holdings Ltd.
Summary and Recommendation for rezoning of 6065-6075 Collingwood Place from R1-1 District to RR-2B District. Referral to Public Hearing at Council Meeting on October 17, 2023. Recommended Approval by General Manager of Planning, Urban Design and Sustainability, with conditions. Approval of rezoning and draft zoning amendment by-law recommended. Director of Legal Services instructed to prepare necessary Housing Agreement By-law. Subdivision By-law to be amended. Adoption of Recommendations A to C with specified conditions.

Rezoning Application for 6065-6075 Collingwood Place
Casey Peters contacted Vancouver City Council regarding the rezoning application for 6065-6075 Collingwood Place. The recommendation is to refer the application to a Public Hearing along with the recommendations of the General Manager of Planning, Urban Design and Sustainability. The rezoning application is to change the lands from RS-5 District to RR-2B District. The recommendation also includes the preparation of necessary by-laws and amendments to the Subdivision By-law. The report concludes that the application meets the intent of the Secured Rental Policy and recommends its approval in principle, subject to the Public Hearing and conditions outlined in Appendix B. The subject site is comprised of two legal parcels with a total area of approximately 2,443.4 sq. m. The site is currently zoned RS-5 and developed with two single-detached homes. The proposal aligns with the priorities of the Housing Vancouver Strategy. The SRP generally supports up to four-storey mixed-use and five-storey residential apartments on arterials, and up to four-storey townhouses or apartments on sites off arterials. Up to six storeys may be considered for projects on arterials where the residential component includes a minimum 20% permanently secured below-market rental housing or 100% social housing. This application complies with the location criteria under SRP for five-storey buildings.

description: Ardor Development Ltd. is requesting to rezone 5515-5525 Elizabeth Street from Residential to Comprehensive Development District. This would allow for the construction of a four-storey residential building with a partial 5th floor rooftop amenity area, containing 27 strata-titled residential units. The proposed floor space ratio is 2.0 and the maximum building height is 13.7 m (45 ft.), with additional height for the rooftop amenity and mechanical appurtenances. The General Manager of Planning, Urban Design and Sustainability recommends approval of the rezoning application, subject to certain conditions. The draft CD-1 By-law and the proposed form of development are also recommended for approval. The approval is subject to the Conditions of Approval contained in the report. Additionally, the Subdivision By-law would be amended if the CD-1 By-law is approved. The passage of the resolutions does not create legal rights or obligations for the applicant or the City. The approval of the rezoning does not obligate the City to enact a by-law rezoning the property. The exercise of authority and discretion by the City and its officials is not limited or directed by the resolutions.

rawSummaries.summary:
3231-3245 Fraser Street and 675 East 17th Avenue
To rezone 3231-3245 Fraser Street and 675 East 17th Avenue from C-2 (Commercial) District to CD-1 (Comprehensive Development) District, to permit the development of a 14-storey mixed-use building with a partial 15th floor rooftop amenity area, with commercial at-grade and 110 secured rental housing units, of which 20% of the residential floor area will be secured as moderate income units, over three levels of underground parking. A floor space ratio of 6.9 and a maximum building height of 45.5 m (149 ft.) with additional height to 47.5 m (156 ft.) for a partial 15th floor rooftop amenity area are proposed. Applicant: Anthem Fraser Developments LP. Recommended Approval: By the General Manager of Planning, Urban Design and Sustainability, subject to the following conditions as proposed for adoption by resolution of Council: A. Application by Anthem Fraser Developments LP, on behalf of Anthem Fraser Developments Ltd. and Mercer Properties (Fraser 17) Inc., to rezone the properties from C-2 (Commercial) District to CD-1 (Comprehensive Development) District to increase the maximum floor space ratio (FSR) from 3.5 to 6.9 and the maximum building height from 22.0 m (72 ft.) to 45.5 m (149.3 ft.) to permit the development of a 14-storey mixed-use building, and a maximum of 47.5 m (155.8 ft.) to accommodate a partial 15th floor rooftop amenity area, containing 110 secured rental housing units, of which 20% of the residential floor area will be secured as moderate income units, with commercial space on the ground floor generally as presented in the Report, be approved in principle. B. Subject to approval in principle of the rezoning and the Housing Agreement described in Part 2 of Appendix B of the report, the Director of Legal Services be instructed to prepare the necessary Housing Agreement By-law for enactment prior to enactment of the CD-1 By-law, subject to such terms and conditions as may be required at the discretion of the Director of Legal Services, and the General Manager of Planning, Urban Design and Sustainability. C. Subject to approval of the CD-1 By-law, the application to amend the Sign By-law to establish regulations for the new CD-1, generally as set out in Appendix C of the report, be approved. D. Subject to approval of the CD-1 By-law, the Noise Control By-law be amended to include the CD-1, generally as set out in Appendix C of the report; further, the Director of Legal Services be instructed to bring forward the amendment to the Noise Control By-law at the time of enactment of the CD-1 By-law. E. Recommendations A through D be adopted on the following conditions: (i) passage of the above resolutions creates no legal rights for the applicant or any other person, or obligation on the part of the City; and any expenditure of funds or incurring of costs is at the risk of the person making the expenditure or incurring the cost; (ii) any approval that may be granted following the Public Hearing shall not obligate the City to enact a by-law rezoning the property, and any costs incurred in fulfilling requirements imposed as a condition of rezoning are at the risk of the property owner; and (iii) the City and all its officials, including the Approving Officer, shall not in any way be limited or directed in the exercise of their authority or discretion, regardless of when they are called upon to exercise such authority or discretion.

description: Recommends rezoning the site at 6470 Larch Street to RR-2B District for a five-storey rental building with 33 secured rental units. The development aligns with the Vancouver Plan, Secured Rental Policy, RR Zoning District Schedules, and other relevant policies. The Residential Rental Districts Schedules Design Guidelines provide direction on the form of development expectations under each of the RR zones. The guidelines support new missing middle buildings that foster neighbourliness and social connection, and contribute to an evolving streetscape with more architectural variety and diversity of housing options. The Housing Vancouver Strategy, approved in November 2017, aims to shift the supply of new homes towards the right supply, with targets for new units along a continuum of housing types. The strategy's core goals include retaining diversity of incomes and households, shifting housing production towards rental, and coordinating action with government and non-profit partners to deliver housing for the lowest income households. The strategy targets 72,000 new homes over a 10-year period, including 12,000 social, supportive, and non-profit co-operative units, and 20,000 purpose-built rental units. Nearly 50% of the new units are intended for households earning less than $80,000 per year, and 40% are family-size units.

description: The development at 692 West 30th Avenue involves rezoning from R1-1 District to RM-8A District to allow for a townhouse or rowhouse development. The site area is approximately 746.2 sq. m (8,032 sq. ft.) with a frontage of 17.1 m (56 ft.) along 30th Avenue. The proposed rezoning aligns with the Vancouver Plan and Cambie Corridor Plan, and staff recommend referring it to a Public Hearing with the recommendation to approve it in principle, subject to conditions. Architectural drawings are not required at this stage, and the review is limited to a plan amendment to the Zoning and Development By-law. The development permit process streamlines rezoning, and no Urban Design Panel review is required for small scale buildings with comprehensive design guidelines.

rawSummaries.summary:
Rezoning: 692 West 30th Avenue - RTS 16004
This report recommends rezoning 692 West 30th Avenue from R1-1 District to RM-8A District to allow for a townhouse or rowhouse development. The application meets the requirements of the Cambie Corridor Plan and staff recommend referring it to a Public Hearing with the recommendation to approve it in principle, subject to conditions. The subject site at 692 West 30th Avenue is a single parcel located on the southeast corner of West 30th Avenue and Heather Street. The site area is approximately 746.2 sq. m (8,032 sq. ft.) with a frontage of 17.1 m (56 ft.) along 30th Avenue. The Vancouver Plan and Cambie Corridor Plan guide the growth and development of the area. The proposed rezoning aligns with the plans and allows for townhouse or rowhouse development. Rezoning to RM-8A follows a simplified process. Architectural drawings are not required at this stage, and the review is limited to a plan amendment to the Zoning and Development By-law. The development permit process streamlines rezoning. No Urban Design Panel review required for small scale buildings with comprehensive design guidelines.

description: Rezoning of the property at 688 West 29th Avenue from R1-1 District to RM-8A District for townhouse or rowhouse development. Maximum floor space ratio (FSR) can be up to 1.20, allowing for approximately eight townhouses. The subject site at 688 West 29th Avenue is approximately 605.2 sq. m with a frontage of 17.1 m along 29th Avenue. Surrounding sites have been rezoned to RM-8A and the BC Women's and Children's Hospital to the west is zoned CD-1. The proposed rezoning meets the intent of the Cambie Corridor Plan and is in line with the Vancouver Plan. The development will undergo a streamlined rezoning process and an Urban Design Panel review is not necessary for small-scale buildings with comprehensive design guidelines.

rawSummaries.summary:

Approve the rezoning application by Paramax Homes, on behalf of Vertical Ventures Inc., for 688 West 29th Avenue in principle. Approve the draft zoning amendment by-law prepared for the Public Hearing. Subject to the Conditions of Approval contained in Appendix B. Amend the Subdivision By-law as set out in Appendix C, subject to approval of the zoning amendment by-law. Adopt Recommendations A and B with the specified conditions. Propose rezoning of 688 West 29th Avenue from R1-1 District to RM-8A District for townhouse or rowhouse development. Maximum floor space ratio (FSR) can be up to 1.20, allowing for approximately eight townhouses. Meets the intent of the Cambie Corridor Plan. Vancouver Plan (2022), Cambie Corridor Plan (2018, amended 2023), RM-8, RM-8A, RM-8N and RM-8AN Districts Schedule (2018, amended 2023), RM-8, RM-8N, RM-8A and RM-8AN Guidelines (2018, amended 2023), Housing Needs Report (2022), Bulletin: Density Bonus Contributions (2014, amended 2023), Vancouver Development Cost Levy By-Law No. 9755, Vancouver Utilities Development Cost Levy By-Law No. 12183, Latecomer Policy (2021), Urban Forest Strategy (2014). Cambie Corridor Plan - Guides the transformation of the Corridor into an area for living, working, and more. Design Guidelines - RM-8A/AN Districts Schedule accompanied by clear design guidelines. description: Rezoning of properties at 4330-4408 Arbutus Street and 2092 Nanton Avenue for the development of a six-storey, 162-unit Community Care Facility - Class B. The recommendation is to rezone the lands from R1-1 District to CD-1 District, increase maximum FSR and building height, and permit the development of the facility. The recommendation is to refer the application to a public hearing and prepare the necessary by-law for consideration at the Public Hearing. The Vancouver Plan and Arbutus Ridge, Kerrisdale and Shaughnessy Community Vision support the rezoning. The site is currently regulated by the R1-1 District Schedule. The properties to the east are zoned R1-1 and the sites to the north and west are zoned CD-1. Properties along Arbutus Street are eligible for rezoning consideration under the Secured Market Rental Policy. Neighbourhood amenities include parks, cultural/community spaces, and a local shopping area.

description: The proposed rezoning bylaw amendment aims to establish development guidelines for non-market rental housing on the subject site located at 8304 11th Avenue. The current zoning is R3 Residential District, and the proposed zoning is CD Comprehensive Development District based on RM2 and RM2r Multiple Family Residential Districts and Newcombe Community Plan. The recommendations include preparing and advancing the Rezoning Bylaw to First Reading and Public Hearing, authorizing granting and execution of Statutory Rights of Way over 8304 11th Avenue, sending the report to project partners, and establishing prerequisites for rezoning completion. The proposed development guidelines indicate Comprehensive Development District zoning and a maximum height of five-storeys, with a maximum potential density of up to 1.4 FAR. The City will provide necessary services and utilities for the site, and statutory rights-of-way are required for off-site servicing and infrastructure installation. A Section 219 Covenant is required prior to construction commencing on the site.

description: Rezoning application for multiple family residential development in Willingdon Lands Urban Village Master Plan Phase 1. The development consists of three buildings: a six-storey non-market rental building, a 14-storey market rental and non-market rental building, and a 20-storey leasehold strata building with street-oriented townhomes. The proposed zoning is an amended CD Comprehensive Development District based on RM5 and RM5r Multiple Family Residential Districts, and the Willingdon Lands Master Plan as guidelines. The development plan is entitled 'Willingdon Phase 1/Burnaby, BC' prepared by Arcadis. The site is designated as Urban Village and Business Centre in Official Community Plan Amendment Bylaw #14451, and the Willingdon Lands Master Plan establishes a conceptual plan for a mixed-use urban village community. The proposed rezoning application is consistent with various policies and plans adopted by Council. The applicant has proposed to separate the film studio from the residential component of Phase 1 and build it in a subsequent phase. The proposed development plan for Phase 1 includes three multiple family residential buildings with underground parking. 'Midrise 1A' is a six-storey non-market rental building located on the north side of the Phase 1 site, 'Tower 1B' is a 20-storey leasehold strata building situated at the intersection of Goard Way and Willingdon Avenue, and 'Tower 1C' is a 14-storey rental building with a mix of market rental units and non-market rental units. Vehicular access to the Phase 1 site is from the new east-west road, with two separate underground parkades and a central servicing courtyard for loading, waste collection, and pick up and drop off.

The proposed rezoning application is consistent with various policies and plans adopted by Council, including the Corporate Strategic Plan, Regional Context Statement, Official Community Plan, Economic Development Strategy, Social Sustainability Strategy, Environmental Sustainability Strategy, Transportation Plan, and HOME: Housing and Homelessness Strategy.

Executive Summary: Rezoning application received for multiple family residential development in Willingdon Lands Urban Village Master Plan Phase 1
Development consists of three buildings: six-storey non-market rental building, 14-storey market rental and non-market rental building, and 20-storey leasehold strata building with street-oriented townhomes
Policy Section: Proposed rezoning application consistent with various policies and plans adopted by Council
Background: Willingdon Lands site designated as Urban Village and Business Centre in Official Community Plan Amendment Bylaw #14451
Willingdon Lands Master Plan establishes conceptual plan for mixed-use urban village community
Rezoning report for Phase 1 of Willingdon Lands Urban Village received, proposing rezoning of subject development site
In accordance with its Urban Village designation under the Official Community Plan and Willingdon Lands Master Plan, Council authorized staff to work with the applicant on a suitable plan of development. The applicant has now submitted a plan of development for presentation at a Public Hearing.
The Willingdon Lands Master Plan originally proposed seven phases of construction. The applicant has proposed to separate the film studio from the residential component of Phase 1 and build it in a subsequent phase. The proposed development plan for Phase 1 includes three multiple family residential buildings with underground parking.
'Midrise 1A' is a six-storey non-market rental building located on the north side of the Phase 1 site. It is rented at 20% below CMHC Market Median rental rates. 'Tower 1B' is a 20-storey leasehold strata building situated at the intersection of Goard Way and Willingdon Avenue. It includes street-oriented townhomes and an outdoor rooftop amenity space. 'Tower 1C' is a 14-storey rental building with a mix of market rental units and non-market rental units. It has both indoor and outdoor amenity space and a green roof terrace.
Vehicular access to the Phase 1 site is from the new east-west road. There are two separate underground parkades and a central servicing courtyard for loading, waste collection, and pick up and drop off.
