address: 4430 Halifax Street, 4488 Halifax Street, 1801 Willingdon Avenue
description: The proposed development plan includes two high-rise residential apartment buildings atop a non-market residential rental and commercial/retail podium with underground parking. Phase 1 consists of a single 60 storey residential strata apartment building, a 9 storey non-market rental podium with townhouses fronting Buchanan Street, and locally scaled commercial retail units fronting Halifax Street. Phase 2 includes a single 43 storey mixed-use tower with market rental uses located on the upper floors, office uses in the podium, and locally scaled commercial retail units at the base of the building fronting all bounding streets and public spaces. The proposed rezoning application is consistent with various policies and plans adopted by Council and is in accordance with Phase 1 and 2 of the Brentwood West Master Plan.

rawSummaries.summary:
REZ #22-28 - 4430, 4488 Halifax Street, and 1801 Willingdon Avenue
A rezoning application has been received for the construction of two high-rise mixed tenure residential apartment buildings atop a commercial podium and underground parking in accordance with the Brentwood West Master Plan. The proposed development plan includes two main phases, with Phase 1 comprising a single 60 storey residential strata apartment building, a 9 storey non-market rental podium with townhouses, and locally scaled commercial retail units. Phase 2 comprises a single 43 storey mixed-use tower with market rental uses, office uses in the podium, and locally scaled commercial retail units. The subject site is approximately 7090.08 m2 in size and is comprised of three individual parcels and a portion of Buchanan Street, which is identified for closure under the Brentwood Town Centre Development Plan. The proposed zoning is an amended CD Comprehensive Development District based on C3 General Commercial District, RM5s Multiple Family Residential District, RM5r Multiple Family Residential District, and Brentwood Town Centre Plan as guidelines.

REZ #22-28 - 4430, 4488 Halifax Street, and 1801 Willingdon Avenue
A rezoning application has been received for the construction of two high-rise mixed tenure residential apartment buildings atop a commercial podium and underground parking in accordance with Phase 1 and 2 of the Brentwood West Master Plan. The proposed development plan for the subject site includes two high-rise residential apartment buildings atop a non-market residential rental and commercial/retail podium with underground parking. Phase 1 includes a single 60 storey residential strata apartment building, a 9 storey non-market rental podium with townhouses fronting Buchanan Street, and locally scaled commercial retail units fronting Halifax Street. Phase 2 includes a single 43 storey mixed-use tower with market rental uses located on the upper floors, office uses in the podium, and locally scaled commercial retail units at the base of the building fronting all bounding streets and public spaces. The proposed rezoning application is consistent with various policies and plans adopted by Council. On July 25, 2022, Council granted Final Adoption to Rezoning Reference #19-19 for the Brentwood West Conceptual Master Plan. The Master Plan aims to guide development of the subject site into a multi-phased, high-density, mixed-use area with housing options, employment opportunities, and public open space provisions.

description: A rezoning application has been received for the construction of a high density mixed-use development at 3965 North Road within the Lougheed Core Area Master Plan. The proposal includes a high-rise strata residential building, high-rise non-market and market rental residential building, commercial podium with an office component and street-fronting retail, and underground parking. The current zoning is C4 Service Commercial District, and the proposed zoning is CD Comprehensive Development District based on RM5s Multiple Family Residential District, RM5r Multiple Family Residential District, C3 General Commercial District, Lougheed Core Area Master Plan, and Lougheed Town Centre Plan. The rezoning application is consistent with various policies and plans adopted by Council, including the Regional Context Statement, Corporate Strategic Plan, Official Community Plan, Lougheed Town Centre Plan, Lougheed Core Area Master Plan, Economic Development Strategy, Social Sustainability Strategy, Environmental Sustainability Strategy, and Climate Action Plan. The subject site is currently improved with a gas service station and an older two-storey office commercial building. The adopted Lougheed Core Area Master Plan is a reconceptualization of a 29.1 hectare area into a vibrant, pedestrian and transit-connected, mixed-use community with diverse housing, employment, service, and recreation opportunities. The Master Plan provides direction related to the general land use, form, massing, subdivision pattern, site servicing, development phasing, and distribution of applicable development densities in the core area. The Master Plan includes eight major development phases for the lands encompassing the Lougheed Mall and select properties to the south, including the subject site. All sites within the Master Plan are designated for high-density mixed-use development based on land uses and densities permitted under the RM5s, C3 and P2 Districts. The subject property was identified as a single tower site to accommodate the density associated with the RM5s and C3 Districts. With the adoption of the Final Rental Use Zoning Policy in 2020 to support the development of rental units in the City, the subject rezoning application is required to comply with Stream 2 – Inclusionary Rental.

Rezoning application REZ #21-15 for 3965 North Road seeks to redevelop the property into a high density mixed-use development in accordance with the Lougheed Core Area Master Plan and Lougheed Town Centre Plan. The proposal includes high-rise residential buildings, a commercial podium, and underground parking. The recommendation is to forward the application to a future Public Hearing. The subject site is currently occupied by a gas service station and an older two-storey office commercial building. The Lougheed Core Area Master Plan reconceptualizes the area into a vibrant, pedestrian and transit-connected, mixed-use community, with the subject property designated for high-density mixed-use development based on land uses and densities permitted under the RM5s, C3, and P2 Districts. The rezoning application is required to comply with Stream 2 – Inclusionary Rental as per the Final Rental Use Zoning Policy adopted in 2020.

The rezoning application is consistent with various policies and plans adopted by Council, including the Regional Context Statement, Corporate Strategic Plan, Official Community Plan, Lougheed Town Centre Plan, Lougheed Core Area Master Plan, Economic Development Strategy, Social Sustainability Strategy, Environmental Sustainability Strategy, and Climate Action Plan. The subject site is currently improved with a gas service station and an older two-storey office commercial building. The adopted Lougheed Core Area Master Plan is a reconceptualization of a 29.1 hectare area into a vibrant, pedestrian and transit-connected, mixed-use community with diverse housing, employment, service, and recreation opportunities. The Master Plan provides direction related to the general land use, form, massing, subdivision pattern, site servicing, development phasing, and distribution of applicable development densities in the core area. The Master Plan includes eight major development phases for the lands encompassing the Lougheed Mall and select properties to the south, including the subject site. All sites within the Master Plan are designated for high-density mixed-use development based on land uses and densities permitted under the RM5s, C3 and P2 Districts. The subject property was identified as a single tower site to accommodate the density associated with the RM5s and C3 Districts. With the adoption of the Final Rental Use Zoning Policy in 2020 to support the development of rental units in the City, the subject rezoning application is required to comply with Stream 2 – Inclusionary Rental.

description: Rezoning application received to allow for neighbourhood commercial uses in an office building located at 3700 Gilmore Way. The applicant, Canadian Turner Construction Company, is requesting rezoning to amended CD District to permit addition of select commercial uses in Building 1, including cafes, restaurants, fitness and health facilities, and childcare facilities. There is also an opportunity for a childcare facility for up to 247 children. The proposed site includes 624 parking spaces and 7 loading spaces for Building 1 and Building 2. Minor adjustments to the design for Building 1 have been made since the adoption of REZ #19-52, enabling an expanded end-of-trip facility with universal washrooms and changing amenities, as well as relocation of bicycle lockers from Level 1 to the parkade resulting in a minor increase to the office floor area on Level 1.

rawSummaries.summary:
REZ #23-02 - 3700 Gilmore Way
Applicant: Canadian Turner Construction Company
Current Zoning: CD Comprehensive Development District
Proposed Zoning: Amended CD Comprehensive Development District
Address: 3700 Gilmore Way
Legal: Lot A District Lots 71 and 72 Group 1 NWD Plan LMP39888
Recommendations: Prepare a Rezoning Bylaw for REZ #23-02 and advance it to First Reading and a Public Hearing. Establish prerequisites for the rezoning, including a suitable plan of development, a fire safety plan, and approval from the Ministry of Transportation and Infrastructure. Chief Administrative Officer's Comments: I concur with the recommendation. Executive Summary: Rezoning application received to allow for neighbourhood commercial uses in an office building. Recommend bringing the Rezoning Bylaw forward for First Reading and forwarding the application to a future Public Hearing. Proposed rezoning application consistent with various policies and plans adopted by Council. Development site located on the north side of Sanderson Way between Willingdon Avenue and Gilmore Way. Site zoned Comprehensive Development District based on M8 Advanced Technology Research District, M5 Light Industrial District, and Discovery Place Community Plan. Existing office building on-site, with two new office buildings under construction. Initial rezoning report proposed ground-oriented commercial uses in Building 1, with potential for a rooftop outdoor childcare play area. Applicant requesting rezoning to amended CD District to permit addition of select commercial uses in Building 1. Proposed commercial uses include cafes, restaurants, fitness and health facilities, and childcare facilities. Opportunity for a childcare facility for up to 247 children. Proposed site includes 624 parking spaces and 7 loading spaces for Building 1 and Building 2. Stalls for parking and loading are not anticipated with future tenant improvement applications. Minor adjustments to the design for Building 1 have been made since the adoption of REZ #19-52. These adjustments enable an expanded end-of-trip facility with universal washrooms and changing amenities. The bicycle lockers have also been relocated from Level 1 to the parkade. This resulted in a minor increase to the office floor area on Level 1.

description: The rezoning application is for the construction of a five-storey self-storage facility with underground parking at 3945 Myrtle Street. The proposed zoning is CD Comprehensive Development District, based on M1 Manufacturing District and M2 General Industrial District guidelines. The development includes 872 storage units, bike lockers, end of trip facility, and amenity space. Vehicular access to the parking areas will be from Still Creek Avenue, and pedestrians and vehicles will exit the site through Myrtle Street.

rawSummaries.summary:
REZ #22-24 - 3945 Myrtle Street
The rezoning application for 3945 Myrtle Street proposes the construction of a five-storey enclosed self-storage facility with two levels of underground parking. The proposed zoning is CD Comprehensive Development District, based on M1 Manufacturing District and M2 General Industrial District guidelines. The purpose of the rezoning is to permit a self-storage facility business model specifically for small businesses, with 872 climate-controlled storage units, bike lockers for employees, two levels of underground parking, and intensive security systems. The facility is also located within a 900 m walking distance of the Gilmore SkyTrain Station, providing access for individuals and businesses across Metro Vancouver. Concerns were raised about self-storage uses in industrial zoning districts, but the self-storage use is permitted in industrial zoning districts according to the City of Burnaby's Official Community Plan and Metro 2050 land use designations. The proposed self-storage facility aligns with the Metro Vancouver Regional Industrial Lands Strategy and City of Burnaby's Official Community Plan, aiming to intensify employment and floor space on redeveloping industrial land.

REZ #22-24 - 3945 Myrtle Street
The rezoning application is for a five-storey enclosed self-storage facility with underground parking located at 3945 Myrtle Street. The current zoning is M6 Truck Terminal District and R5 Residential District, and the proposed zoning is CD Comprehensive Development District based on M1 Manufacturing District and M2 General Industrial District guidelines. The application includes 872 storage units, bike lockers, end of trip facility, indoor and outdoor amenity space, and pedestrian access from a walkway. Still Creek Avenue will be the vehicular access to the parking areas, and pedestrians and vehicles will exit the site through Myrtle Street. The recommendation is to prepare a Rezoning Bylaw for REZ #22-24 and advance it to First Reading and a Public Hearing at a future date of Council.

REZ #22-24 - 3945 Myrtle Street
REZ #22-24 is a rezoning application for the construction of a five-storey self-storage facility with underground parking located at 3945 Myrtle Street. The applicant is Tony Russo of 1074649 BC Ltd. The proposed zoning is CD Comprehensive Development District, based on M1 Manufacturing District and M2 General Industrial District guidelines. The proposal includes 872 storage units, bike lockers, end of trip facility, and amenity space. Still Creek Avenue will be the vehicular access to the parking areas, and pedestrians and vehicles will exit the site through Myrtle Street. The General Manager Planning and Development recommends preparing a Rezoning Bylaw for REZ #22-24 and advancing to First Reading and a Public Hearing at a future date of Council. The Chief Administrative Officer concurs with the recommendation.

description: The purpose of this permit is to seek Council authorization to forward the application to a future Public Hearing. The address for this permit is a portion of 250 Willingdon Ave, with the street address being 4595 Albert Street. The current zoning is CD Comprehensive Development District based on P3 Park and Public Use District, and the proposed zoning is P3 Park and Public Use District. The recommendation is to prepare a Rezoning Bylaw for First Reading and Public Hearing. The subject site is a portion of Confederation Park at 250 Willingdon Ave, currently zoned CD Comprehensive Development District with McGill Library and City Archive. The proposed rezoning is to standardize zoning for the City-owned Confederation Park. The majority of the park is currently zoned P3 Park and Public Use, except for the subject site. The rezoning would make the portion of the site occupied by McGill Library legally non-conforming to the Zoning Bylaw with respect to the side yard setback to Alpha Avenue. There is no accompanying development with this rezoning application. The site area is 18.416 ha, with a site coverage of 4%. The total required vehicle parking for the entire parcel is 451 spaces, and the total provided is 501 spaces.

The permit includes a bylaw to rezone a portion of the site, authorization for drafting the development permit, and approval for development variance permit. description: The zoning and development permit is for the address 19590 - 32 Avenue. It involves the rezoning from A-1 to IB-1 and a development permit for a 9,026 square metre light impact industrial business park building. The permit also includes a LAP Amendment to reduce the 'Open Space Corridors/Buffer' width and a Development Variance Permit to vary several setbacks and parking requirements. The final decision was to introduce a bylaw to rezone the site, draft the development permit, and approve the development variance permit. The resolution also includes instructions to resolve various issues prior to final adoption, and to amend the Campbell Heights Local Area Plan to reduce the 'Open Space Corridors/Buffers' width from 30 metres to 20 metres.

Ltd., is requesting to rezone the site at 19590 - 32 Avenue from General Agriculture Zone to Business Park 1 Zone in order to develop a light impact industrial business park building, 9,026 square metre in size. The proposal also includes a Development Variance Permit to reduce minimum yard setbacks, vary off-street parking and loading/unloading space, and reduce the rate at which parking is calculated for industrial floor area associated with the proposed building. The Public Hearing included opposition from delegations citing concerns about biodiversity, tree removal, ecosystem, traffic volumes, trees, water wells, and compensation for tree removal per acre.

description: The application is for a NCP Amendment from 'Urban Single Family Residential' to 'Single Family Small Lots', as well as a Rezoning from RA to RF and RF-13. Additionally, there is a Development Variance Permit to allow subdivision into 5 single family small lots. The proposed development includes front accessed double side-by-side garages under the 'Single Family Residential (13) Zone (RF-13)', with varying lot widths for each proposed lot. The project also involves resolving various issues prior to final adoption, including engineering requirements, tree preservation, tree replacement, density bonus amenity contribution, affordable housing strategy, and demolition of existing buildings and structures. Furthermore, there is a resolution to amend the East Newton South Neighbourhood Concept Plan (NCP) to redesignate the land from 'Urban Single Family Residential' to 'Single Family Small Lots' when the project is considered for final adoption.

description: Avtar Bhullar has applied to rezone 10111 & 10113 No. 5 Road from the 'Single Detached (RS1/E)' zone to the 'Arterial Road Compact Two-Unit Dwellings (RCD)' zone. This would permit the property to be subdivided to create three lots each containing a front-to-back duplex with vehicle access from the existing rear lane. The existing strata-titled non-conforming two-unit dwelling on the site is proposed to be demolished. The surrounding development consists of single-family dwellings and a temple. The proposed rezoning is consistent with the Official Community Plan (OCP) Land Use Map designation for 'Neighbourhood Residential' and the Arterial Road Policy. It also complies with the Lot Size Policy 5434, allowing for the creation of three lots with vehicle access from the rear lane. A landscape buffer is proposed along the No. 5 Road frontage to mitigate land use conflicts with agricultural land uses on the east site. Staff recommends the introduction and first reading of the rezoning bylaw.

description: Gurjit Pooni has applied to rezone 9371 Dolphin Avenue from 'Single Detached (RSl/B)' zone to 'Single Detached (RS2/K)' zone in order to subdivide the property into two single-family lots with access from Dolphin Avenue. The existing tenant-occupied single-family dwelling on the property will be demolished. The proposed rezoning and subdivision are consistent with the Official Community Plan and the Broadmoor Planning Area - Ash Street Sub Area Plan. description: Lung Designs Ltd. has applied to rezone 7560 Ash Street from the 'Single Detached (RS 1/F)' zone to the 'Single Detached (RS2/E)' zone to allow the property to be subdivided into two single-family lots. The existing single-family dwelling on the western portion of the lot will remain on proposed Lot 1. The proposed subdivision plan is in Attachment 2. The surrounding development consists of two single-family lots to the north and south, and a single-family dwelling to the east. The Official Community Plan (OCP) land use designation for the subject property is 'Neighbourhood Residential' (NRES). The proposed lots comply with minimum lot sizes and designations. The proposed redevelopment must meet the requirements of the Richmond Flood Plain Designation and Protection Bylaw 8204. Public consultation has not received any comments from the public. The proposed rezoning and subdivision to create two single-family lots is consistent with redevelopment along this block of Ash Street. The vehicle access to lots is proposed from Ash Street and Armstrong Street. The applicant agrees to plant a minimum of two trees in the front and back yards of each proposed lot.

description: The development in question is a NCP Amendment from 'Multiple Residential 10-15 upa' to 'Multiple Residential 15 -25 upa' and to remove the subject site from the land consolidation area. Additionally, there is a Rezoning from RA to RM-30. The proposed development is for a 24-unit townhouse development. The decision made was to introduce a Bylaw to rezone the subject site from 'One-Acre Residential Zone (RA)' to 'Multiple Residential 30 Zone (RM-30)' and to set a date for Public Hearing. Council also authorized staff to draft Development Permit No. 7921-0057-00 generally in accordance with the attached drawings, and the finalized Ecosystem Development Plan and geotechnical report. Furthermore, Council approved Development Variance Permit No. 7921-0057-00, varying the minimum yard setbacks of the RM-30 Zone. Council instructed staff to resolve various issues prior to final adoption and passed a resolution to amend the Sunnyside Heights Neighbourhood Concept Plan (NCP) to redesignate the land from 'Multiple Residential 10-15 upa' to 'Multiple Residential 15-25 upa' and to remove the subject site from the land consolidation area when the project is considered for final adoption.

description: Rezoning and development permit for 12585 - 15 Avenue, to rezone a portion of the site from RF to RF-O in order to permit subdivision into 4 single detached lots. The council endorsed the Public Notification to proceed for Bylaw No. 21062 to rezone a portion of the subject site, as identified as Block A in the attached Survey Plan, from 'Single Family Residential Zone (RF)' to 'Single Family Residential Oceanfront Zone (RF-O)'. They also authorized staff to draft Development Permit No. 7918-0345-00 for Hazard Lands (Steep Slopes) and Sensitive Ecosystems (Streamside Areas) generally in accordance with the finalized Geotechnical report and Ecosystem Development Plan. Additionally, they approved Development Variance Permit No. 7918-0345-00, varying the setbacks and offsets to proceed to Public Notification. The council instructed staff to resolve various issues prior to final adoption, including engineering requirements, demolition of existing buildings, submission of a subdivision layout, tree preservation, landscaping plan, Ecosystem Development Plan, Geotechnical Report, and addressing the City’s needs with respect to the City’s Affordable Housing Strategy.

description: Hari Singh Gill has applied to rezone the property at 3300 Granville Avenue from the “Single Detached (RS1/E)” zone to the “Single Detached (RS2/B)” zone to allow the property to be subdivided into two single-family lots. The existing single-family dwelling on the site will be demolished prior to subdivision. The proposed subdivision plan is consistent with the Official Community Plan (OCP) land use designation for the subject property, which is “Neighbourhood Residential” (NRES). The proposed rezoning and subdivision application is also consistent with the Lot Size Policy 5447, which allows for the subdivision of the subject property consistent with the R1/B zone. The proposed redevelopment must meet the requirements of the Richmond Flood Plain Designation and Protection Bylaw 8204, and registration of a flood indemnity covenant on Title is required prior to final adoption of the rezoning bylaw. A rezoning sign has been installed on the subject property, and staff have not received any comments from the public about the rezoning application. The applicant is proposing to rezone the subject site and subdivide it into two single-family lots, each with a one bedroom secondary suite. Vehicle access is proposed to be from Granville Avenue, and the existing driveway will be removed and new driveways will be constructed through a Servicing Agreement.

LTD, the registered owner of 2560 Trafalgar Street and Rajinder Singh Sran and Mandeep Singh Jhattu, the registered owners of 2580 Trafalgar Street. description: The proposed rezoning application seeks Council approval to execute and register a Statutory Right-of-Way in favor of BC Hydro over 7679 and 7701 - 18th Street to permit the installation of an overhead pole line to serve the Southgate neighborhood. The developer will be responsible for undergrounding the line in the future. The proposed Statutory Right-of-Way measures approximately 190 m in length and ranges in width from 8.0 m to 11.7 m. The City has not requested compensation for the Statutory Right-of-Way.

rawSummaries.summary:
REZ #14-25
Proposed Statutory Right of Way for BC Hydro Overhead Power Line - Edmonds Town Centre Plan. Seek Council approval to execute and register a Statutory Right-of-Way in favor of BC Hydro over 7679 and 7701 - 18th Street to permit the installation of an overhead pole line to serve the Southgate neighborhood. The proposed rezoning application is consistent with the Corporate Strategic Plan (2022), Official Community Plan (1998), Edmonds Town Centre Plan Area (1994), Economic Development Strategy (2007), and Southgate Master Plan (2015). The City-owned properties at 7679 and 7701 - 18th Street were initially included in the Southgate Master Plan to accommodate a future road connection. However, as the properties are no longer being developed concurrently with the Southgate neighborhood, an overhead power line is proposed to serve the area. The developer will be responsible for undergrounding the line in the future. Staff will work with BC Hydro to finalize the agreement for the installation of the power line. The proposed Statutory Right-of-Way measures approximately 190 m in length and ranges in width from 8.0 m to 11.7 m. The City has not requested compensation for the Statutory Right-of-Way. Recommendation: Authorize the execution and registration of a Statutory Right-of-Way in favor of BC Hydro over portions of 7679 and 7701 - 18th Street to permit the installation of an overhead pole line to serve the Southgate neighborhood.

description: Rezoning application for a minor increase in interior floor area in Unit #5 at 8063 North Fraser Way. The proposal includes the addition of a 225.75 m2 (2,430 sq. ft.) mezzanine for office use, as well as minor changes to parking and loading. The proposal is to amend the CD Comprehensive Development District based on M2 General Industrial and M5 Light Industrial Districts. The recommendation is to abandon the predecessor Rezoning Bylaw, prepare and advance the Rezoning Bylaw to First Reading and Public Hearing at a future date, and establish prerequisites for rezoning completion. The proposed rezoning application is consistent with various plans and strategies. The renovation proposal includes a new mezzanine structure for office use in Unit #5 of the existing building, with no changes to the exterior of the building proposed. The total gross floor area for the entire building is proposed to increase from 9,755.38 m2 (105,006 sq. ft.) to 9,981.13 m2 (107,436 sq. ft.), and the total gross floor area for Unit #5 is proposed to increase from 1,312.81 m2 (14,131 sq. ft.) to 1,538.57 m2 (16,561 sq. ft.). The density is proposed to be 0.54 FAR.

description: The application is for the rezoning of the address 19044 - 32 Avenue from 'Intensive Agriculture Zone (A-2)' to 'Business Park 1 Zone (IB-1)'. The proposed development is a 9,976-square-metre multi-tenant industrial building. The owner is QRD (Silver) Holdings Inc. and the agent is Orion Construction (Paul Bangma). The decision made was to introduce a Bylaw for rezoning and set a date for Public Hearing. Council also authorized the drafting of Development Permit No. 7922-0080-00 and approved Development Variance Permit No. 7922-0080-00, which varies the minimum side yard setback and the minimum landscape strip requirement of the IB-1 Zone. Council has instructed staff to resolve various issues prior to final adoption.

APPLICANT: Owner: QRD (Silver) Holdings Inc.

PURPOSE: The applicant is requesting to rezone the subject site from Intensive Agriculture Zone to Business Park 1 Zone in order to permit the development of a 9,976 square metre multi-tenant industrial building. In addition, the proposal includes a Development Variance Permit to reduce the minimum side yard (east) setback from 3.6 metres to 0.0 metres to the principal building face and to reduce the minimum landscape strip requirement along 32 Avenue (arterial road) from 6 metres to 2.4 metres. The Notice of the Public Hearing was read by the City Clerk.

description: Rezoning from RA to RF-12 and RF-13 and Development Variance Permit for 6227 and 6245 - 150 Street. The permit allows subdivision into 9 single-family lots. The council approved the rezoning and development variance permit, with specific variances for lot width and garage requirements. Staff was instructed to resolve various issues prior to final adoption, including engineering requirements, tree preservation, affordable housing strategy, and parkland provisions. Demolition of existing buildings and structures was also required, along with the registration of a Section 219 Restrictive Covenant for 'no build' on a portion of proposed Lot 1 until future development.

description: The development in question involves the rezoning of the property from RA to RF-10, with a NCP Amendment from 'Small Lot (10 UPA)' to 'Small Lot with Lane (13 UPA)'. The proposed development includes the subdivision of two lots into 4 single family lots, with a variance to reduce the minimum lot width of a Type II Interior Lot in the RF-10 Zone. The applicant, 1351582 B.C. Ltd., along with the agent Gursimer Design & Management Inc., is seeking approval for the development variance permit and resolution of various issues including engineering requirements, tree preservation, density bonus amenity contribution, affordable housing strategy, and demolition of existing buildings and structures. Additionally, there are requirements for the registration of Section 219 Restrictive Covenants and approval from the Ministry of Transportation & Infrastructure. The project also involves the amendment of the West Newton / Highway 10 Neighbourhood Concept Plan (NCP) to redesignate the land from 'Small Lot (10 UPA)' to 'Small Lot with Lane (13 UPA)' upon final adoption.

Additionally, a Development Variance Permit has been approved, varying various setbacks and lot coverage requirements. Council has instructed staff to resolve various issues prior to final adoption.

description: The development permit is for the rezoning of 13233 and 13245 - 108 Avenue and 10825 - 132A Street from 'Single Family Residential Zone (RF)' to 'Comprehensive Development Zone (CD'. The owner, Grand Foundation Investment Ltd., is proposing the construction of a 6-storey residential apartment building. The development will include addressing various issues such as engineering requirements, urban design, landscaping plan, tree preservation and replacement, demolition of existing buildings, acoustical report, and registration of restrictive covenants to address public art, affordable housing, and live-work units.

7922-0092-00

APPLICANT: Owner: Grand Foundation Investment Ltd. (Director Information: X. Li, N. Cao) Agent: Martin Liew Architect - AIBC (Martin Liew)

PURPOSE: The applicant is requesting to rezone the subject site from Single Family Residential Zone to Comprehensive Development Zone in order to permit the development of a 6-storey residential apartment building.

Regular Council - Public Hearing Minutes September 25, 2023

Page 13

The Notice of the Public Hearing was read by the City Clerk.

R. Landale, Fleetwood: The delegation spoke in opposition to the proposal citing traffic impacts and other projects in the area.

D. Jack, Surrey Environmental Partners: The delegation spoke to the proposal citing tree removal, green walls, and stormwater management.

Written submissions were received as follows:
• R. Landale expressing opposition for the proposal citing traffic, trees and more portable schools.

description: The application is for a OCP Text Amendment and City Centre Plan Amendment to allow for a density of 11.3 FAR within the 'Central Business District Area 2'. It also includes a Rezoning from C-8 to CD, and a Development Permit to permit the development of a 42-storey mixed-use tower with a 6-storey podium consisting of 11,224 square metres of commercial and office space and 365 residential dwelling units. The proposed development is located at 13511, 13521, 13531, 13541 and 13551 - 102 Avenue. The development will also involve amendments to the Official Community Plan (OCP) Table 7A: Land Use Designation Exemptions within the 'Downtown' designation to permit a density up to 11.3 FAR. The proposal also includes various engineering requirements, urban design, landscaping, tree preservation, noise mitigation measures, public rights-of-passage, public art, transportation impact assessment, transportation demand management, density bonus amenity contribution, and vehicle access. The total project value is estimated at $50 million.

rawSummaries.summary:
7923-0013-00
CIVIC ADDRESS: 13511, 13521, 13531, 13541, and 13551 - 102 Avenue

APPLICANT: Owner: Marcon City Parkway Properties Ltd.
(Director Information: M. Paolella)
Agent: Marcon City Parkway (GP) Ltd. (Thomas Rowe)

PURPOSE: The applicant is requesting to amend the Official
Community Plan (OCP) Table 7A: Land Use Designation
Exemptions by adding site specific permission for the subject
site to permit a density up to 11.3 FAR (gross density

calculation) within the "Downtown" designation.
The proposal also includes rezoning the same site from
Community Commercial Zone to Comprehensive
Development Zone to develop a 42-storey mixed-use tower
with a 6-storey podium consisting of 11,224 square metres of
commercial and office space and 365 residential dwelling units.

The Notice of the Public Hearing was read by the City Clerk.

7923-0013-00
OCP Text Amendment to allow for a density of 11.3 FAR, City Centre Plan Amendment to allow for a density of 11.3 FAR within the "Central Business District Area 2", Rezoning from C-8 to CD, Development Permit to permit the development of a 42-storey mixed-use tower with a 6-storey podium consisting of 11,224 square metres of commercial and office space and 365 residential dwelling units. A Bylaw be introduced to amend Official Community Plan (OCP) Table 7A: Land Use Designation Exemptions within the "Downtown" designation by adding site specific permission for subject site 13511, 13521, 13531, 13541 and 13551 - 102 Avenue, to permit a density up to 11.3 FAR (gross density calculation), and a date be set for Public Hearing. Council determine the opportunities for consultation with persons, organizations and authorities that are considered to be affected by the proposed amendment to the Official Community Plan, as described in the Report, to be appropriate to meet the requirement of Section 475 of the Local Government Act. A Bylaw be introduced to rezone the subject site from "Community Commercial Zone (C-8)" to "Comprehensive Development Zone (CD)" and a date be set for Public Hearing. Council authorize staff to draft Development Permit No. 7923-0013-00 generally in accordance with the attached drawings (Appendix I). Council instruct staff to resolve various issues prior to final adoption related to engineering requirements, urban design, landscaping, tree preservation, noise mitigation measures, public rights-of-passage, public art, transportation impact assessment, transportation demand management, density bonus amenity contribution, and vehicle access. Council pass a resolution to amend the Surrey City Centre Plan to allow for an FAR of 11.3 within the "Central Business District - Area 2 (7.5 FAR)" designation, when a minimum of 3.5 FAR of office/commercial space is provided, when the project is considered for final adoption.

description: Rezone 351-359 West 16th Avenue from RT-5 (Residential) District to CD-1 (Comprehensive Development) District. Allow the development of a four-storey and a three-storey residential building with 13 secured rental units. Proposed height: 11.5 metres (38 feet). Proposed floor space ratio (FSR): 1.45. Increase the floor space ratio (FSR) from 0.75 to 1.45 and the building height from 10.7 m (35 ft.) to 11.5 m (38 ft.). Permit a four-storey and a three-storey residential building with 13 secured rental units. Referral: Report titled 'CD-1 Rezoning: 351 West 16th Avenue', dated July 11, 2023. Referred to Public Hearing at the Council Meeting of July 25, 2023.

rawSummaries.summary:
CD-1 REZONING: 351-359 West 16th Avenue
Rezone 351-359 West 16th Avenue from RT-5 (Residential) District to CD-1 (Comprehensive Development) District. Allow the development of a four-storey and a three-storey residential building with 13 secured rental units. Proposed height: 11.5 metres (38 feet). Proposed floor space ratio (FSR): 1.45. Applicant: Haeccity Studio Architecture. Referral: Report titled 'CD-1 Rezoning: 351 West 16th Avenue', dated July 11, 2023. Referred to Public Hearing at the Council Meeting of July 25, 2023. Recommended Approval: By the General Manager of Planning, Urban Design and Sustainability, subject to the following conditions: A. Approve the application by Haeccity Studio Architecture, on behalf of Panagiotis and Despina Kefalas, to rezone the lands from RT-5 (Residential) District to CD-1 (Comprehensive Development) District. Increase the floor space ratio (FSR) from 0.75 to 1.45 and the building height from 10.7 m (35 ft.) to 11.5 m (38 ft.). Permit a four-storey and a three-storey residential building with 13 secured rental units, as presented in the Report. B. Instruct the Director of Legal Services to prepare the necessary Housing Agreement By-laws for enactment prior to enactment of the CD-1 By-law, subject to approval in principle of the rezoning and the Housing Agreements described in Part 2 of Appendix B of the Report. C. Adopt Recommendations A and B on the following conditions: (i) The passage of the above resolution creates no legal rights or obligations for the applicant or any other person, or the City. Any expenditure of funds or costs incurred is at the risk of the person making the expenditure or incurring the cost. (ii) Any approval granted following the public hearing does not obligate the City to enact a by-law rezoning the property. Any costs incurred in fulfilling requirements imposed as a condition of rezoning are at the risk of the property owner. (iii) The City and all its officials, including the Approving Officer, are not limited or directed in the exercise of their authority or discretion, regardless of when they are called upon to exercise such authority or discretion.

description: Rezone 3747-3761 Renfrew Street from C-1 (Commercial) District to CD-1 (Comprehensive Development) District. Permit development of a four-storey mixed-use building with 18 secured market rental residential units and commercial space on the ground floor. Proposed height of 16.3 meters (53 feet) and 17.8 meters (58 feet) for rooftop amenity. Proposed floor space ratio (FSR) of 2.5. Recommended Approval: By General Manager of Planning, Urban Design and Sustainability, subject to conditions proposed for adoption by Council resolution. A. Approve application by Sian Enterprises Ltd. to rezone lands from C-1 (Commercial) District to CD-1 (Comprehensive Development) District. Increase maximum FSR from 1.2 to 2.5 and maximum building height from 9.2 m (30 ft.) to 16.3 m (53 ft.) and 17.8 m (58 ft.) for rooftop amenity. Permit development of four-storey mixed-use building with 18 secured market rental residential units and commercial space on ground floor as presented in the Report. B. Instruct Director of Legal Services to prepare necessary Housing Agreement By-law for enactment prior to CD-1 By-law enactment, subject to approval in principle of rezoning and Housing Agreement described in Part 2 of Appendix B of the report. C. Approve application to amend Sign By-law to establish regulations for CD-1 as set out in Appendix C of the report, subject to approval of CD-1 By-law. D. Amend Noise Control By-law to include this CD-1 in Schedule B as set out in Appendix C of the report. Instruct Director of Legal Services to bring forward the amendment to Noise Control By-law at time of enactment of new CD-1 By-law. E. Adopt Recommendations A to D with specified conditions.

description: This report recommends a plan amendment to the Zoning and Development By-law from RT-2 (Residential) District to RR-3B (Residential Rental) District, for the site located at 5504-5536 Victoria Drive. The amendment would allow for a six-storey mixed-use rental building of which 20% of the residential floor area is secured as below-market rental units, in accordance with the Secured Rental Policy. An estimated total of 69 secured rental units (55 at market rates and 14 at below-market rates) would be delivered through this application. A future building design would be submitted through the development permit process and reviewed with the public at that time. Staff have assessed the application and conclude that it meets the intent of the SRP. Staff recommend that the application be referred to a Public Hearing, with the recommendation of the General Manager of Planning, Urban Design and Sustainability to approve it in principle, subject to the Public Hearing, and conditions contained within Appendix B.

description: The proposed amendment recommends rezoning the properties at 4721 Oak Street from RS-5 (Residential) District to RM-8AN (Residential) District to allow for a townhouse or rowhouse development. The maximum floor space ratio (FSR) for RM-8AN is 1.20, allowing for approximately six to eight townhouse units on one 50 ft.-wide lot. The application aligns with the intent of the Cambie Corridor Plan. Staff recommend that the application be referred to a Public Hearing, with the recommendation of the General Manager of Planning, Urban Design and Sustainability to approve it in principle, subject to the Public Hearing, and conditions contained within Appendix B.

rawSummaries.summary:

This report recommends a plan amendment to the Zoning and Development By-law for 4721 Oak Street. The proposed amendment would rezone the properties from RS-5 (Residential) District to RM-8AN (Residential) District to allow for a townhouse or rowhouse development. The maximum floor space ratio (FSR) for RM-8AN is 1.20 and can generate approximately six to eight townhouse units on one 50 ft.-wide lot. The application meets the intent of the Cambie Corridor Plan (the “Plan”). Staff recommend that the application be referred to a Public Hearing, with the recommendation of the General Manager of Planning, Urban Design and Sustainability to approve it in principle, subject to the Public Hearing, and conditions contained within Appendix B.

description: The report recommends a plan amendment to the Zoning and Development By-law from RS-6 (Residential) District to RR-2C (Residential Rental) District for the site located at 2005-2045 West 49th Avenue. The proposed amendment would allow for a six-storey market rental building, with 20% of the residential floor area secured as below-market rental units in accordance with the Secured Rental Policy. The application is for a total of 111 secured market rental units. A future building design would be submitted through the development permit process and reviewed with the public at that time. Staff have assessed the application and recommend that it be referred to a Public Hearing, with the recommendation of the General Manager of Planning, Urban Design and Sustainability to approve it in principle, subject to the Public Hearing and conditions contained within Appendix B.

rawSummaries.summary:

This report recommends a plan amendment to the Zoning and Development By-law from RS-6 (Residential) District to RR-2C (Residential Rental) District, for the site located at 2005-2045 West 49th Avenue. The amendment would allow for a six-storey market rental building, of which 20% of the residential floor area is secured as below-market rental units in accordance with the Secured Rental Policy. An estimated total of 111 secured market rental units would be delivered through this application. A future building design would be submitted through the development permit process and reviewed with the public at that time. Staff have assessed the application and conclude that it meets the intent of the SRP. Staff recommend that the application be referred to a Public Hearing, with the recommendation of the General Manager of Planning, Urban Design and Sustainability to approve it in principle, subject to the Public Hearing, and conditions contained within Appendix B.

description: Rezoning from CG-2 to C-5 and Development Permit / Development Variance Permit for 12758 - 28 Avenue. The permit is for the conversion of an existing service station building to accommodate a restaurant and office space. The council authorized staff to draft the development permit and approve the development variance permit, which includes varying setbacks, parking spaces, and landscaping requirements. The council also instructed staff to resolve various engineering, urban design, and landscaping issues prior to final adoption.

rawSummaries.summary:
7921-0197-00
CIVIC ADDRESS: 12758 - 28 Avenue

APPLICANT: Owner: Crescent Station Inc. (Director Information: Brock Nelson Dorward, Erin Christine McCutcheon) Agent: Waissbluth Architecture Office Inc (Nicholas Waissbluth)

PURPOSE: The applicant is requesting to rezone the site from Combined Service Gasoline Station Zone to Neighbourhood Commercial Zone in order to allow the conversion of an existing service station building to accommodate a restaurant and office space. In addition, the proposal includes a Development Variance Permit to: • Reduce the minimum front (north) yard setback from 7.5 metres to 3.85 metres for the principal building; • Reduce the minimum side (west) yard setback from 7.5 metres to 0 metres for the principal building; • Reduce the minimum side (east) yard setback from 7.5 metres to 3.0 metres to the principal building face; • Reduce the minimum side (east) yard setback from 7.5 metres to 1 metre for accessory structures; • Reduce the minimum number of off-street parking spaces for an eating establishment from 10 stalls per 100 square metres of floor area to 2.3 stalls per 100 square metres of floor area; • Waive the requirement for continuous screen planting at least 1.5 m high in a strip at least 1.5 m wide and a solid decorative fence at least 1.5 m high along all lot lines separating the developed portion of the lot from any lot designated Residential in the OCP, except in those portions where a building abuts the lot line; and • Reduce the requirement for a continuous landscaping strip for the developed portions of the lot abutting a highway from 1.5 metres to 0.75 metres.

CIVIC ADDRESS: 13839 and 13853 – 58 Avenue

APPLICANT: Owner: S N D Development Ltd.
(Director Information: C. Sran)
Agent: Hub Engineering Inc. (Jakub Czoch)

PURPOSE: The applicant is requesting to rezone the subject site from One-Acre Residential Zone to Single Family Residential (13) Zone in order to allow subdivision into 9 single family lots. In addition, the proposal includes a Development Variance Permit to reduce the minimum lot depth from 24 metres to 23 metres for proposed Lot 3, to 21.2 metres for proposed Lot 4, and to 22 metres for proposed Lot 5 and 6, to reduce the minimum lot width from 13.4 metres to 12.4 metres for proposed Lot 7, to 12.5 metres for proposed Lot 8 and to 12.2 metres for proposed Lot 9, and to allow a double garage that can accommodate two vehicles parked side by side to be accessed from the front yard on a Type II interior lot, that is less than 13.4 metres wide on proposed Lots 7, 8 and 9.

description: 1243059 BC Ltd. has applied to rezone 12120 No. 5 Road from the 'Agriculture (AG1)' zone to the 'Light Industrial (IL)' zone to permit the development of two multi-tenant industrial buildings for a total of 13 strata-titled units. The proposed light industrial development consists of two buildings in a North-South arrangement with a bridging element over the drive aisle access to No. 5 Road. The two buildings total approximately 4,266 m2 in light industrial space and 1,276 m2 in ancillary office space. The buildings front No. 5 Road and have a proposed setback of 3.28 m from No. 5 Road and proposed height of 11.6 m, complying with Zoning Bylaw 8500. Landscaping including tree replacement planting within the front yard setback, in conjunction with required frontage upgrades along No. 5 Road (multi-use pathway and landscaped boulevard), will improve the pedestrian scale of the development. Vehicle access to the site will be provided at the rear through the continuation and dedication of an existing lane established from Rice Mill Road. This lane is ultimately intended to extend south to the City-owned road allowance south of 12200 No. 5 Road.

REZ #21-47 - 4472 Hastings Street
REZ #21-47 is an application for the construction of a five-storey mixed-use multiple-family strata residential development with commercial retail uses at grade and underground parking located at 4472 Hastings Street. The current zoning is C8a Urban Village Commercial District (Hastings) and the proposed zoning is CD Comprehensive Development District. description: Rezoning application received for the construction of 92 CMHC market median rental townhouses and 91 market rental townhouses. The subject site measures approximately 4.24 hectares and is located within Sub-Area 3 of the Edmonds Town Centre Plan. The Bevan Lands site is designated for multiple-family development using the RM3 Multiple Family Residential District. The site for this rezoning application includes a portion of 6229 Marine Drive, six properties on Bevan Street (including three owned by Mosaic), and a portion of road to be closed. rawSummaries.summary:
REZ #22-04
A rezoning application has been received for the construction of 92 CMHC market median rental townhouses and 91 market rental townhouses. The subject site measures approximately 4.24 hectares and is located within Sub-Area 3 of the Edmonds Town Centre Plan. It is part of a larger site measuring approximately 0.80 hectares. The site is designated for multiple-family development using the RM3 Multiple Family Residential District. The rezoning application includes a portion of 6229 Marine Drive, six properties on Bevan Street, and a portion of road to be closed. One single-family dwelling remains on 7580 Bevan Street, owned by Mosaic. The remaining properties are vacant or undeveloped. The site slopes significantly from the northeast to the southwest. The proposed rezoning application is consistent with various policies and plans adopted by Council. The report recommends forwarding the rezoning application to a future Public Hearing.

REZ #22-04
Purpose Built Rental Townhouse Development – Edmonds Town Centre Plan. Applicant: Kristine Liu; Mosaic Avenue Developments Ltd. 500-2609 Granville Street, Vancouver BC V6H 3H3. Current Zoning: CD Comprehensive Development District (based on RM2r Multi-Family Residential District and Edmonds Town Centre Plan as guidelines). Proposed Zoning: Amended CD Comprehensive Development District (based on RM2r Multi-Family Residential District and Edmonds Town Centre Plan as guidelines, and in accordance with the development plan entitled “Bevan Townhomes” prepared by Ekistics Architecture). Recommendations: 1. Prepare a Rezoning Bylaw for REZ #22-04 and advance it to First Reading and a Public Hearing at a future date. 2. Authorize the introduction of a Highway Closure Bylaw, contingent upon the granting of Second Reading of the Rezoning Bylaw. 3. Establish prerequisites for the completion of the rezoning, including the submission of a suitable plan of development, deposit of sufficient monies, completion of a servicing agreement, installation of underground wiring, removal of existing improvements, completion of the Highway Closure Bylaw, acquisition of specific properties, registration of Ground Leases, dedication of rights-of-way, submission of a Site Disclosure Statement, granting of necessary statutory rights-of-way, submission of a Stormwater Management System, compliance with Groundwater Management guidelines, submission of a Solid Waste and Recycling Plan, review of on-site loading facilities, provision of garbage handling and recycling space, provision of facilities for cyclists, submission of a geotechnical review, compliance with sound criteria, tree survey and arborist report, submission of a Green Building Plan and Energy Benchmarking, and deposit of applicable charges. Executive Summary: Rezoning application received for the construction of 92 CMHC market median rental townhouses and 91 market rental townhouses. Recommend forwarding the application to a future Public Hearing. Background: Subject site measures approximately 4.24 hectares and is located within Sub-Area 3 of the Edmonds Town Centre Plan. Forms a large development site with a smaller adjacent site. The Bevan Lands site is designated for multiple-family development using the RM3 Multiple Family Residential District. It slopes significantly from the northeast to the southwest. Until recently, Bevan Lands included twenty properties, three owned by Mosaic Homes and the rest owned by the City. The site for this rezoning application includes a portion of 6229 Marine Drive, six properties on Bevan Street (including three owned by Mosaic), and a portion of road to be closed. One single-family dwelling remains on 7580 Bevan Street, owned by Mosaic. The remaining properties are vacant or undeveloped. To the west are properties designated for single-family development or future rezoning. To the east is Fourteenth Avenue Ravine Park. To the north, across Southridge Drive, is a recently developed townhouse and low-rise project. To the south, across Marine Drive, are single-family dwellings in the Big Bend Development Plan area, with agricultural properties beyond.

description: The REZ #21-45 application is for the BCIT Master Sign Plan located at 3700 Willingdon Avenue and 4355 Mathissi Place. The current zoning for 3700 Willingdon Avenue is P6 BCIT Zoning District, CD Comprehensive Development District, and P6 Regional Institutional District. The proposed zoning for 3700 Willingdon Avenue includes an amended CD Comprehensive Development District, P6 Regional Institutional, and P6 BCIT Zoning Districts. The current zoning for 4355 Mathissi Place is CD Comprehensive Development District. The proposed zoning for 4355 Mathissi Place includes an amended CD Comprehensive Development District. The recommendation is to prepare a Rezoning Bylaw for First Reading and Public Hearing, and to establish prerequisites for the completion of the rezoning. The Chief Administrative Officer concurs with the recommendation of the General Manager Planning and Development. The amendment to the BCIT Burnaby Campus Master Sign Plan (MSP) is to provide a comprehensive signage program, and no specific development is sought in connection to this rezoning application. The proposed rezoning application aligns with various City policies. The background includes information about the BCIT Burnaby Campus, previous rezonings, and the requirement for Comprehensive Sign Plans (CSPs) for major development applications.

rawSummaries.summary:
REZ #21-45
REZ #21-45 - BCIT Master Sign Plan. Addresses: 3700 Willingdon Avenue, 4355 Mathissi Place. Applicant: British Columbia Institute of Technology (c/o Chris Forrest), 3700 Willingdon Avenue, Burnaby, BC V5G 3H2. Current Zoning: 3700 Willingdon Avenue: P6 BCIT Zoning District, CD Comprehensive Development District, P6 Regional Institutional District. 4355 Mathissi Place: CD Comprehensive Development District. Proposed Zoning: 3700 Willingdon Avenue: Amended CD Comprehensive Development District, P6 Regional Institutional District, P6 BCIT Zoning Districts. 4355 Mathissi Place: Amended CD Comprehensive Development District. Recommendation: Prepare and advance a Rezoning Bylaw to First Reading and a Public Hearing at a future date. Establish prerequisites to the completion of the rezoning, including the submission of a suitable plan of development, a Section 219 Covenant ensuring no third-party advertising components, and approval from the Ministry of Transportation. Chief Administrative Officer's Comments: Concur with the recommendation of the General Manager Planning and Development. Executive Summary: The amendment to the BCIT Burnaby Campus Master Sign Plan (MSP) will provide a comprehensive signage program for existing and future signs. No specific development is being sought in connection to this rezoning application. Policy Section: The proposed rezoning application aligns with various City policies, including the Corporate Strategic Plan, Official Community Plan, Economic Development Strategy, Social Sustainability Strategy, Environmental Sustainability Strategy, Climate Action Framework, and Transportation Plan. Background: The BCIT Burnaby Campus consists of a main campus site and a smaller site known as the Centre for Applied Research and Innovation (CARI). The campus has undergone previous rezonings to allow for the installation of sky signs. A Comprehensive Sign Plan (CSP) was established to provide guidelines for signage opportunities. The BCIT Campus Plan was approved to guide development of the Burnaby Campus. Comprehensive Sign Plans (CSPs) and Master Sign Plans (MSPs) are required for major development applications. Character of the site permits under an amendment bylaw to the Burnaby Zoning Bylaw.

applicant: Brendan Reeves of Boffo Developments (Beresford) Ltd
description: A rezoning application has been received for the construction of a six-storey purpose built residential rental building at 5650 Beresford Street. The proposed zoning is CD Comprehensive Development District, based on RM3 Multiple Family Residential District, RM3r Multiple Family Residential District, and the Royal Oak Community Plan. The current zoning is M2 General Industrial District. The purpose of the report is to recommend forwarding the rezoning application to a future Public Hearing. The recommendations include preparing and advancing a Rezoning Bylaw to First Reading and to a Public Hearing at a future date, authorizing the introduction of a Housing Agreement Bylaw, authorizing the introduction of a Highway Closure Bylaw, approving in principle the sale of City-owned property for inclusion within the subject development site, and establishing prerequisites to the completion of the rezoning. The proposed rezoning application is consistent with various policies and plans adopted by Council. On October 04, 2021, Council approved a report seeking endorsement of a density and rental obligation transfer between the subject site (Beresford Site) and the Bassano Master Plan Site, owned by the applicant, in order to deliver a fully non-market rental project. The subject site will initially serve as rental housing for displaced tenants from development sites within the Metrotown Downtown Plan Area and beyond. The rental units will be delivered prior to or concurrently with Phase 1 of the Bassano Site. These units will satisfy the inclusionary rental requirement for Phases 1 and 2 of the Bassano Site, as well as the inclusionary requirement for the subject site. Displaced residents from other rental developments can be housed at the subject site until their unit in their new development is ready. Tenants will only be responsible for the portion of the rent equivalent to their rent at the time of rezoning, with the developer paying any applicable rent top-up. After Phase 3 of the Bassano Site is completed, the subject site's required rental units will revert to standard inclusionary rental rates, set at 20% below CMHC median market rates for the Southeast Burnaby rental survey area. Phase 3 of the Bassano Site will include a non-market rental podium to meet the overall inclusionary rental requirement for both sites. Additional voluntary rental units at the subject site or Bassano Site can be provided as a mix of market and non-market rental units on a 1:1 basis. A density transfer between the two sites is proposed to facilitate this.

address: 2160 Springer Avenue, 2210 Springer Avenue, 5334 Lougheed Highway
description: Rezoning application received for Phase 1 of Bassano Site Master Plan. The transfer aims to create a fully non-market rental project at the Beresford Site, initially serving as rental housing for displaced tenants from development sites within the Metrotown Downtown Plan Area and beyond. The rental units will be delivered before or at the same time as Phase 1 of the Bassano Site, fulfilling the inclusionary rental requirement for Phases 1 and 2 of the Bassano Site, as well as the inclusionary requirement for the Beresford Site. Displaced residents from other developments can temporarily reside at the Beresford Site until their new unit is ready. Tenants will only be responsible for the portion of rent equivalent to their rent at the time of rezoning, with the developer paying any additional rent. Once Phase 3 of the Bassano Site is completed, the required rental units at the Beresford Site will revert to standard inclusionary rental rates, set at 20% below CMHC median market rates for the Southeast Burnaby rental survey area. Phase 3 of the Bassano Site will include a non-market rental podium to meet the overall inclusionary rental requirement for both the Bassano and Beresford Sites. Additional voluntary rental units at the Beresford or Bassano Site, utilizing RMr density, can be a mix of market and non-market rental units on a 1:1 basis as permitted under the Rental Use Zoning Policy. A density transfer between the two sites is proposed to facilitate this.

rawSummaries.summary:
REZ #21-30 - Portion of 2160 Springer Avenue, 2210 Springer Avenue, and Portion of 5334 Lougheed Highway
A rezoning application has been received for the construction of Phase 1 of the Bassano Site Master Plan, consisting of a high-rise residential building with retail and underground parking. The proposed rezoning application is consistent with various policies and plans adopted by Council. On July 25, 2022, Council granted Final Adoption to Rezoning Reference #17-14 for the Bassano Site Conceptual Master Plan. The intent was to guide site-specific rezoning applications for high-density apartment development. Development, with street-fronting townhouses, comprises Phase 1 of the three-phased Master Plan. On October 04, 2021, Council approved a report endorsing a density and rental obligation transfer between the subject site and 5650 Beresford Street (Beresford Site), owned by the applicant. This transfer aims to deliver a fully non-market rental project at the Beresford Site. The Beresford Site will initially serve as rental housing for displaced tenants from development sites within the Metrotown Downtown Plan Area and beyond, while their replacement rental unit is constructed. The rental units will be delivered prior to or concurrently with Phase 1 of the Bassano Site. These units will satisfy the inclusionary rental requirement for Phases 1 and 2 of the Bassano Site, as well as the inclusionary requirement for the Beresford Site. Displaced residents from other developments can be housed at the Beresford Site until their unit in the new development is ready. Tenants will only be responsible for the portion of the rent equivalent to their rent at the time of rezoning, with the developer paying any applicable rent top-up. After the completion of Phase 3 of the Bassano Site, the Beresford Site's required rental units will revert to the standard inclusionary rental rates, set at 20% below CMHC median market rates for the Southeast Burnaby rental survey area. Phase 3 of the Bassano Site will include a non-market rental podium to meet the overall inclusionary rental requirement for both the Bassano and Beresford Sites. Additional voluntary rental units at the Beresford or Bassano Site, utilizing RMr density, can be provided as a mix of market and non-market rental units on a 1:1 basis as permitted under the Rental Use Zoning Policy. A density transfer between the two sites is proposed to facilitate this.

REZ #21-30 - Portion of 2160 Springer Avenue, 2210 Springer Avenue, and Portion of 5334 Lougheed Highway
Rezoning application received for Phase 1 of Bassano Site Master Plan. Recommend forwarding to future Public Hearing. On October 04, 2021, Council approved a report endorsing a density and rental obligation transfer between the subject site and 5650 Beresford Street (Beresford Site), owned by the applicant. This transfer aims to create a fully non-market rental project at the Beresford Site. The Beresford Site will initially serve as rental housing for displaced tenants from development sites within the Metrotown Downtown Plan Area and beyond. These tenants will be relocated while their replacement rental unit is being constructed. The rental units will be delivered before or at the same time as Phase 1 of the Bassano Site. These units will fulfill the inclusionary rental requirement for Phases 1 and 2 of the Bassano Site, as well as the inclusionary requirement for the Beresford Site. Displaced residents from other developments can temporarily reside at the Beresford Site until their new unit is ready. Tenants will only be responsible for the portion of rent equivalent to their rent at the time of rezoning, with the developer paying any additional rent. Once Phase 3 of the Bassano Site is completed, the required rental units at the Beresford Site will revert to standard inclusionary rental rates, set at 20% below CMHC median market rates for the Southeast Burnaby rental survey area. Phase 3 of the Bassano Site will include a non-market rental podium to meet the overall inclusionary rental requirement for both the Bassano and Beresford Sites. Additional voluntary rental units at the Beresford or Bassano Site, utilizing RMr density, can be a mix of market and non-market rental units on a 1:1 basis as permitted under the Rental Use Zoning Policy. A density transfer between the two sites is proposed to facilitate this. Further details on the proposed swing site concept can be found in the Beresford Site rezoning report (Rezoning Reference #21-29), which is also on Council's agenda.

address: 8520 Railway Avenue, 8540 Railway Avenue, 8560 Railway Avenue
behalf: SD Railway Homes Inc. and in partnership with Richmond Kiwanis Seniors Citizens Housing Society
description: The application is for the rezoning of 8520, 8540 & 8560 Railway Avenue from the “Single Detached (RS1/E)” Zone to the “Low Rise Rental Apartment (ZLR47) – Railway Avenue (Blundell)” Zone. The proposal is for the construction of a 100 per cent rental residential apartment development consisting of a four-storey building, containing 58 units for seniors. This includes 29 Low-End Market Rental (LEMR) units and 29 market rental units. The building will also include indoor and outdoor amenity spaces, and will meet Energy Step Code Step 4. Road and engineering improvement works will be required and secured through the City’s standard Servicing Agreement process prior to final adoption of the rezoning bylaw. The proposal complies with the market rental housing policies as the project is 100 per cent rental housing with a component of affordable rental. The redevelopment must also meet the requirements of the Richmond Flood Plain Designation and Protection Bylaw 8204, including the registration of a flood indemnity covenant on Title.

rawSummaries.summary:
RZ 21-936046
Application by Winston Chong Architect Inc. for Rezoning at 8520, 8540 & 8560 Railway Avenue from the “Single Detached (RS1/E)” Zone to the “Low Rise Rental Apartment (ZLR47) – Railway Avenue (Blundell)” Zone. Staff Recommendation: 1. Official Community Plan Bylaw 9000, Amendment Bylaw 10479, to change the designation of 8520, 8540 & 8560 Railway Avenue from “Neighbourhood Residential” to “Apartment Residential” in Attachment 1 to Schedule 1 of Official Community Plan Bylaw 9000 (City of Richmond 2041 OCP Land Use Map), be introduced and given first reading. 2. Bylaw 10479, having been considered in conjunction with the City’s Financial Plan and Capital Program, and the Greater Vancouver Regional District Solid Waste and Liquid Waste Management Plans, is hereby found to be consistent with said programs and plans, in accordance with Section 477(3)(a) of the Local Government Act. 3. Bylaw 10479, having been considered in accordance with OCP Bylaw Preparation Consultation Policy 5043, is hereby found not to require further consultation. 4. Richmond Zoning Bylaw 8500, Amendment Bylaw 10480 to create the “Low Rise Rental Apartment (ZLR47) – Railway Avenue (Blundell)” zone, and to rezone 8520, 8540 & 8560 Railway Avenue from “Single Detached (RS1/E)” to “Low Rise Rental Apartment (ZLR47) – Railway Avenue (Blundell)”, be introduced and given first reading. Origin Winston Chong Architect Inc., on behalf of SD Railway Homes Inc. and in partnership with Richmond Kiwanis Seniors Citizens Housing Society, has applied to the City of Richmond for permission to rezone 8520, 8540 & 8560 Railway Avenue (Attachment 1) from the “Single Detached (RS1/E)” zone to a new site-specific zone, “Low Rise Rental Apartment (ZLR47) – Railway Avenue (Blundell)”, in order to permit the construction of a 100 per cent rental residential apartment development consisting of a four-storey building, containing 58 units for seniors. Key components of the proposal include: - One four-storey apartment building with 58 rental units secured for seniors (55 years and older), including 29 (50 per cent) Low-End Market Rental (LEMR) units and 29 (50 per cent) market rental units. - Approximately 1,534 m2 (16,512 ft2) of purpose-built Low-End Market Rental (LEMR) housing and approximately 1,605 m2 (17,276 ft2) of purpose-built market rental housing. - All purpose-built LEMR units and market rental units will be secured in perpetuity with rental tenure zoning and housing agreements registered on Title. All units will be maintained under a single ownership. - The building will meet Energy Step Code Step 4. - Approximately 102 m2 (1,098 ft2) of indoor amenity space and 495 m2 (5,324 ft2) of shared outdoor amenity space. - Preliminary site plan, building elevations, and landscape plan are contained in Attachment 2. Road and engineering improvement works required with respect to the subject development will be secured through the City’s standard Servicing Agreement process prior to final adoption of the rezoning bylaw. Works including frontage improvements, servicing upgrades and upgrades to the existing City-owned public walkway along the south property line will be designed and constructed at the owner’s sole cost. Findings of Fact A Development Application Data Sheet providing details about the development proposal is attached (Attachment 3). Subject Site Existing Housing Profile The subject site currently contains one single-family dwelling (no secondary suite) at 8520 Railway Avenue, which is vacant. 8540 and 8560 Railway Avenue contain no buildings. Surrounding Development To the North: A single-family dwelling on a lot zoned “Single Detached (RS1/E)”, fronting Railway Avenue. To the South: Across a City-owned public walkway, a 17-unit townhouse development (three and two storeys) (RZ 15-709884 / DP 16-754735) on a lot zoned “Town Housing (ZT80) – Railway Avenue”, fronting Railway Avenue. To the East: Single-family dwellings on lots zoned “Single Detached (RS1/E)”, fronting Calder Road. To the West: Across Railway Avenue and the Railway Greenway, single-family dwellings on lots zoned “Single Detached (RS1/E)”, fronting Lancelot Drive. Related Policies & Studies Official Community Plan The Official Community Plan (OCP) Land Use Map is proposed to be amended to change the designation of the subject site from “Neighbourhood Residential” to “Apartment Residential” in order to allow the proposal. The OCP rental housing policies support site specific density increases for developments that provide affordable and market rental housing to address community need. The proposal complies with the market rental housing policies as the project is 100 per cent rental housing with a component of affordable rental. Further details on the proposed OCP amendment are provided in the “Analysis” section of this report. Floodplain Management Implementation Strategy The proposed redevelopment must meet the requirements of the Richmond Flood Plain Designation and Protection Bylaw 8204. Registration of a flood indemnity covenant on Title is required prior to final adoption of the rezoning bylaw. Public Consultation A rezoning sign has been installed on the subject property. Staff have not received any formal comments from the public about the rezoning application in response to the placement of the rezoning sign on the property. To inform residents of the proposal, the applicant provided a notification package on May 31, 2023 to neighbouring properties with direct adjacency to the subject site, including information on density, height, site plan, elevations, and parking. The applicant has provided a map identifying the properties that were notified (Attachment 4). As of the date of this report, no correspondence has been received in response to the notification package. Should the Planning Committee endorse this application and Council grant first reading to the rezoning bylaw, the bylaw will be forwarded to a Public Hearing, where any area resident or interested party will have an opportunity to comment.

description: The application is for an OCP Amendment from 'Suburban' to 'Urban' and a Rezoning from RA to RF-13. The proposed development includes the subdivision of the subject site into thirteen single-family small lots and one riparian open space (park) lot. The owners of the property are H. Kooner, M. Kooner, G. Kooner, C. Kooner, and the agent representing them is Gursimer Design & Management Inc. (Nirvair Singh). The development also involves the introduction of a Bylaw to amend the Official Community Plan (OCP) and a Bylaw to rezone the subject site. Additionally, there is a request for a Development Permit for Hazard Lands (Steep Slopes) and Sensitive Ecosystems (Streamside Areas) in accordance with the submitted Ecosystem Development Plan and Geotechnical Report. A Development Variance Permit is also being sought to vary setback areas and lot dimensions. The proposed development will involve various issues that need to be resolved prior to final adoption.

rawSummaries.summary:
7921-0264-00
CIVIC ADDRESS: 6617 - 181 Street; 6618 - 180 Street

APPLICANT: Owners: H. Kooner, M. Kooner, G. Kooner, C. Kooner
Agent: Gursimer Design & Management Inc. (Nirvair Singh)

PURPOSE: The applicant is requesting to amend the Official Community Plan (OCP) Figure 3: General Land Use Designations for the subject site from Suburban to Urban. The proposal also includes rezoning the same site from One-Acre Residential Zone to Single Family Residential (13) Zone in order to facilitate subdivision into thirteen single family small lots and one riparian open space (park) lot. In addition, the proposal includes a Development Variance Permit to:

• Reduce the minimum streamside setback area, measured from top of bank, for a Natural Class A Stream from 30 metres to no less than 20 metres;
• Reduce the minimum streamside setback area, measured from top of bank, for a Natural Class B Stream from 15 metres to no less than 10 metres;
• Reduce the minimum lot depth of Type I lots from 28 metres to 26.9 metres for proposed Lots 3 and 4;
• Reduce the minimum lot depth of Type II lots from 24 metres to 18.4 metres for proposed Lot 6;
• Reduce the minimum lot depth of Type II lots from 24 metres to 21 metres for proposed Lot 7;
• Reduce the minimum lot depth of Type I lots from 28 metres to 25.6 metres for proposed Lot 8;
• Reduce the minimum lot width of Type I corner lots from 14 metres to 12 metres for proposed Lot 13; and
• Permit front accessed double side-by-side garages on a lot less than 13.4 metres in width for proposed Lots 1 ,3-5 and 8-12, and on a Type I corner lot for proposed Lot 13.

The Notice of the Public Hearing was read by the City Clerk.

Mayor Locke and Councillor Kooner declared a conflict of interest and left the meeting at 7:31 p.m.
Councillor Nagra assumed the position of Chair as Acting Mayor.

R. Landale, Fleetwood: The delegation expressed opposition to the proposal citing tree removal, parkland, riparian ecosystem, fees, and geotechnical report.

D. Jack, Surrey Environmental Partners: The delegation spoke to tree removal, riparian setbacks, Official Community Plan, and reduced water courses.

A. Kaps, North Surrey: The delegation spoke to variances to stream setbacks.

C. Brigelson, Surrey: The delegation spoke in opposition to the proposal citing the narrow street, parking, density, overcrowded schools, and lot size.

Written submissions were received as follows:
• R. Landale expressing opposition for the proposal citing trees, ecosystem, road, ground stability, park, character, social services and amenities.
• Petition received on July 24, 2023. 10 petition signatures in support for the proposal.
• C. Walashek expressing opposition for the proposal citing trees, ecosystem, road, ground stability, park, character, social services and amenities.
• S. Soo expressing opposition for the proposal citing trees, ecosystem, road, ground stability, park, character, social services and amenities.
• E. Pereira expressing opposition for the proposal citing potential flooding and trees.
• N. Connor expressing concerns for the proposal citing loss of quiet and private backyard, trees, wildlife habitat and fence.

Mayor Locke and Councillor Kooner rejoined the meeting at 7:45 p.m. and the Mayor re-assumed the position of Chair.

Councillor Hepner left the meeting at 7:46 p.m.

Agent: Gursimer Design & Management Inc. (Nirvair Singh)
