Rezoning from RA to RF-13
Development Permit / Development Variance Permit
in order to facilitate subdivision into thirteen single family small lots and one riparian open space (park) lot.

Council approve Development Variance Permit No. 7921-0264-00, varying the following, to proceed to Public Notification:
- to reduce the minimum streamside setback area, measured from top of bank, for a Natural Class A Stream in Part 7A of the Zoning Bylaw No. 12000 from 30 metres to no less than 20 metres;
- to reduce the minimum streamside setback area, measured from top of bank, for a Natural Class B Stream in Part 7A of the Zoning Bylaw No. 12000 from 15 metres to no less than 10 metres;
- to reduce the minimum lot depth of the RF-13 Zone Type I lots from 28 metres to 26.9 metres for proposed Lots 3 and 4;
- to reduce the minimum lot depth of the RF-13 Zone Type II lots from 24 metres to 18.4 metres for proposed Lot 6;
- to reduce the minimum lot depth of the RF-13 Zone Type II lots from 24 metres to 21 metres for proposed Lot 7;
- to the reduce the minimum lot depth of the RF-13 Zone Type I lots from 28 metres to 25.6 metres for proposed Lot 8;
- to reduce the minimum lot width of the RF-13 Zone Type I corner lots from 14 metres to 12 metres for proposed Lot 13; and
- to permit front accessed double side-by-side garages under the RF-13 Zone on a lot less than 13.4 metres in width for proposed Lots 1 ,3-5 and 8-12, and on a Type I corner lot for proposed Lot 13.
Council instruct staff to resolve various issues prior to final adoption.

Development Permit / Development Variance Permit to permit the development of a 6-storey apartment building with approximately 109 dwelling units and underground parking on a consolidated site in Guildford. A Bylaw be introduced to amend Official Community Plan (OCP) Table 7A: Land Use Designation Exemptions within the 'Multiple Residential' designation by adding site specific permission for subject site 14009, 14017, 14027, and 14037 - 100 Avenue, to permit a density up to 2.86 FAR, and a date be set for Public Hearing. Council determine the opportunities for consultation with persons, organizations and authorities that are considered to be affected by the proposed amendment to the OCP, as described in the Report, to be appropriate to meet the requirement of Section 475 of the Local Government Act. A Bylaw be introduced to rezone the properties at 14009, 14017, 14027 and 14037 - 100 Avenue from 'Single Family Residential Zone (RF)' to 'Comprehensive Development Zone (CD)', and a date be set for Public Hearing. Council authorize staff to draft Development Permit No. 7922-0187-00 generally in accordance with the attached drawings (Appendix I). Council approve Development Variance Permit No. 7922-0187-00, varying the following, to proceed to Public Notification: (a) to reduce the minimum required lot width from 15 metres to 12 metres, under the RF Zone, for a proposed remnant lot (Lot B) created from 14030 - 100A Avenue, intended for future land assembly.

description: Rezoning from RF to RF-13 for the subject site located at 13054 - 112 Avenue. The development permit and variance permit are for the subdivision of the site into three single family residential lots. The council has endorsed the public notification for the rezoning and authorized the drafting of Development Permit No. 7923-0015-00 for Hazard Lands and Sensitive Ecosystems, along with the finalized Ecosystem Development Plan and geotechnical report. Additionally, the council approved the Development Variance Permit No. 7923-0015-00 to permit double side-by-side garages on lots that are 13.1 metres in width in the RF-13 Zone for all three proposed lots. Various issues such as engineering requirements, tree preservation, affordable housing strategy, and demolition of existing buildings and structures need to be resolved prior to final adoption.

description: Inter Luck Trading Corp. has applied to rezone 3560 Moncton Street from 'Steveston Commercial (CS2)' to 'Commercial Mixed Use (ZMU43) - Steveston Village' in order to develop a two-storey, mixed-use building containing approximately 419 m2 (4,513 ft2) of commercial space at grade and five residential units above, with vehicular access from the lane to the west. The subject site is located in the Steveston Village Heritage Conservation Area and does not contain an identified heritage resource. The previous proposal under this rezoning application was referred back to staff to review proposed building design and building materials. A revised proposal was presented in March 2021 and was tabled until the Steveston Design Committee is established. Council endorsed amending the terms of reference and membership composition of the Richmond Heritage Commission and endorsed an Enhanced Development Review Process for development proposals in the Steveston Village Heritage Conservation Area. The architect of record for the rezoning application submission was changed in February 2022 to Ken Chow (Interface Architecture) and a new development proposal was submitted and processed in accordance with the Enhanced Development Review Process. The rezoning application is subject to an Enhanced Development Review Process, including engagement of a heritage professional consultant, development of an expanded design rationale, and submission of new architectural drawings based on the principles of the rationale and recommendations from the heritage consultant. The subject site currently contains a vacant one-storey building that was used as a commercial and hardware/marine business until 2018. The surrounding development includes a two-storey commercial building across the street with a rezoning application submitted for a two-storey mixed-use redevelopment, and a rear parking lot of the property fronting onto Bayview Street.

address: 8911 Patterson Road, 8931 Patterson Road, 8951 Patterson Road, 8991 Patterson Road
description: Dava Developments Ltd. has applied to rezone lands at 8911, 8931, 8951, 8991 Patterson Road from the 'Residential Single Family (RS1/F)' zone to a new 'Residential/Limited Commercial (ZMU54)' zone and a 'School & Institutional Use (SI)' zone. The proposed mixed-use mid- and high-rise development includes a total floor area of 17,154.73 m2 (184,651.80ft2) with 163 dwellings, 136 of which are market housing units and 27 are affordable housing units. It also includes 52,834 ft2 of non-residential hotel uses along Garden City Way, and the transfer of parcels to the City for public open space and transportation-related infrastructure. The proposal complies with Official Community Plan (OCP) and City Centre Area Plan (CCAP) policies, as well as requirements for floodplain management, aircraft noise sensitive development, and NAV Canada building height regulations. The staff recommendation is to introduce the rezoning bylaw and give it first reading.

The proposed mixed-use mid- and high-rise development includes a total floor area of 17,154.73 m2 (184,651.80ft2) with 163 dwellings, 136 units of market housing, and 27 units of affordable housing. It also includes 52,834 ft2 of non-residential hotel uses along Garden City Way, transfer of parcels to the City for public open space and transportation-related infrastructure, and park, engineering, and road network improvements. The subject site is currently vacant and surrounded by various zoning designations and developments. The proposal is consistent with current Official Community Plan (OCP) and City Centre Area Plan (CCAP) policies applicable to the subject site. The proposed redevelopment must meet the requirements of the Richmond Flood Plain Designation and Protection Bylaw 8204, and the subject site is located within ANSD 'Area 3', which permits consideration of all aircraft noise sensitive land use types. The proposed maximum building height of 47 m (154 ft.) GSC complies with all applicable Transport Canada regulations.

address: 5800 Granville Avenue, 5840 Granville Avenue, 5860 Granville Avenue
description: Interface Architecture Inc. has applied to rezone 5800, 5840, and 5860 Granville Avenue from the “Single Detached (RS1/E)” zone to the “Low-Density Townhouses (RTL4)” zone. The proposal is to develop 18 townhouse units with vehicle access from Granville Avenue. The existing single-family dwellings on the lots are proposed to be demolished. The surrounding development consists of various zoning types, including single-detached housing, low-density townhouses, and medium-density low-rise apartments. The proposal is consistent with the Official Community Plan (OCP) land use designation for “Neighbourhood Residential” and the Arterial Road Land Use Policy designation for “Arterial Road Townhouse”. The applicant has agreed to register a restrictive covenant on Title to prohibit certain strata bylaws and to make a cash-in-lieu contribution to the Affordable Housing Reserve Fund in the amount of $244,512.00.

rawSummaries.summary:
RZ 21-922202
Interface Architecture Inc. has applied to the City of Richmond for permission to rezone 5800, 5840 and 5860 Granville Avenue from the “Single Detached (RS1/E)” zone to the “Low-Density Townhouses (RTL4)” zone, to permit the property to be developed for 18 townhouse units, with vehicle access from Granville Avenue. The existing dwellings are proposed to be demolished at future development stage. The Official Community Plan (OCP) land use designation for the subject properties is “Neighbourhood Residential”. This redevelopment proposal is consistent with this designation. The Arterial Road Land Use Policy designation for the subject properties is “Arterial Road Townhouse”, subject to the development criteria in the Policy. This redevelopment proposal is consistent with this designation and with the Policy criteria. The applicant has agreed to register a restrictive covenant on Title prior to final adoption of the rezoning bylaw, prohibiting (a) the imposition of any strata bylaw that would prohibit any residential dwelling unit from being rented; and (b) the imposition of any strata bylaw that would place age-based restrictions on occupants of any residential dwelling unit. The applicant proposes to submit a cash-in-lieu contribution to the Affordable Housing Reserve fund in the amount of $12.00 per buildable square foot (for sites outside of the City Centre Area Plan) for a total contribution of $244,512.00 prior to final adoption of the rezoning bylaw.

description: Benito Kho and Verney Kho have applied to rezone 7520 Ash Street from 'Single Detached (RS1/F)' zone to 'Single Detached (RS2/E)' zone to allow the property to be subdivided into two single-family lots. Vehicle access to the west lot (proposed Lot 1) is proposed from Ash Street, while vehicle access to the eastern lot (Lot 2) is proposed from a new extension of Armstrong Street. The existing single-family dwelling on the western portion will remain on proposed Lot 1, and a new single detached house with a secondary suite will be constructed on the eastern portion of the site (proposed Lot 2). The proposed rezoning and subdivision comply with the Official Community Plan (OCP) land use designation for the subject property and the City Centre Area - McLennan South Sub-Area Plan land use designation. The adjacent property owner to the north at 7600 Ash Street has been contacted and has no specific objections to the rezoning application. Vehicle access to the western lot (Lot 1) is proposed from Ash Street via the existing driveway location, while vehicle access to the eastern lot (Lot 2) is proposed from the new Armstrong Street.

description: The application is for an OCP Amendment from 'Suburban' to 'Urban', Rezoning from RA to CD, and LAP Amendment from 'Low Density Townhouse 12-15 UPA Gross' to 'Townhouse 15-20 UPA Gross'. The development permit is for the construction of 58 townhouse units. The applicant is Qualico Developments (Vancouver) Inc. The agent is Aplin & Martin Consultants Ltd. The proposed development will require a Bylaw amendment to the Official Community Plan (OCP) and a rezoning from 'One-Acre Residential Zone (RA)' to 'Comprehensive Development Zone (CD)'. The project also involves various issues to be resolved prior to final adoption, including engineering requirements, urban design issues, landscaping plan, tree survey, geotechnical report, and acoustical report. The proposed development is part of the Abbey Ridge Local Area Plan (LAP) and will involve amending the LAP to redesignate the subject site from 'Low Density Townhouse 12-15 UPA Gross' to 'Townhouse 15-20 UPA Gross' when the project is considered for final adoption.

description: The application is for an OCP Amendment to increase the density from 3.5 FAR to 7.5 FAR in the Central Business District, and a City Centre Amendment from 'Mid to High Rise Residential' to 'High Rise Mixed-Use – Type II'. Additionally, it includes a rezoning from C-8 to CD. The proposed development is for a 37-storey mixed-use tower with a 5-storey podium, consisting of 389 dwelling units and ground floor commercial space. The owner is 1348147 B.C. Ltd. and the agent is Chris Dikeakos Architects Inc. The development permit is for Detailed Development Permit No. 7922-0372-00.

CIVIC ADDRESS: 10318 and 10324 Whalley Boulevard

APPLICANT: Owner: 1348147 B.C. Ltd. (Director Information: Varun Kaura, Kazim Syed) Agent: Chris Dikeakos Architects Inc (Richard Bernstein)

PURPOSE: The applicant is requesting to amend the Official Community Plan (OCP) Figure 16: Downtown Densities for the subject site from 3.5 FAR to 7.5 FAR. The proposal also includes rezoning the site from Community Commercial Zone (C-8) to Comprehensive Development Zone in order to permit the development of a 37-storey mixed-use tower with a 5-storey podium consisting of 389 dwelling units and ground floor commercial space.

The Notice of the Public Hearing was read by the City Clerk.

7922-0372-00
Address: 10318 Whalley Boulevard (10320 Whalley Boulevard, 13735 and 13737 Central Avenue), 10324 Whalley Boulevard (10322, 10326 and 10328 Whalley Boulevard)
Owner: 1348147 B.C. Ltd.
Director Information: Varun Kaura, Kazim Syed
Agent: Chris Dikeakos Architects Inc. (Richard Bernstein)

Rezoning from C-8 to CD

Decision: A Bylaw be introduced to amend the Official Community Plan (OCP) Figure 16: Downtown Densities for the subject site from 3.5 FAR to 7.5 FAR, and a date for Public Hearing be set. Council determine the opportunities for consultation with persons, organizations and authorities that are considered to be affected by the proposed amendment to the OCP, as described in the Report, to be appropriate to meet the requirement of Section 475 of the Local Government Act. A Bylaw be introduced to rezone the subject site from 'Community Commercial Zone (C-8)' to 'Comprehensive Development Zone (CD)' and a date be set for Public Hearing. Council authorize staff to draft Detailed Development Permit No. 7922-0372-00 generally in accordance with the attached drawings (Appendix I). Council instruct staff to resolve various issues prior to final adoption.

description: NCP Amendment from 'Half-Acre Residential' to '6-10 upa (Low Density)' and for changes to the road network. Rezoning from RA to RF-13. Development Variance Permit to allow subdivision into four single family small lots and one oversized single family lot with future subdivision potential. Council endorsed the Public Notification to proceed for Bylaw 20994 to rezone the subject site from 'One-Acre Residential Zone (RA)' to 'Single Family Residential (13) Zone (RF-13)'. Council approved Development Variance Permit No. 7922-0164-00, to permit the construction of front access, side-by-side double garage on lots less than 13.4 metres wide (proposed Lots 1 and 2) in the RF-13 Zone, to proceed to Public Notification. Council instructed staff to resolve several issues prior to final adoption, including engineering requirements, tree preservation, affordable housing strategy, and demolition of existing buildings and structures. Council will pass a resolution when the project is considered for final adoption to amend the East Clayton Neighbourhood Concept Plan (NCP) to redesignate the land from 'Half-Acre Residential' to '6-10 upa (Low Density)' and amend the Aloha Estates Infill Area Plan for changes to the road network.

Council will pass a resolution when the project is considered for final adoption to amend the East Clayton Neighbourhood Concept Plan (NCP) to redesignate the land from 'Half-Acre Residential' to '6-10 upa (Low Density)' and amend the Aloha Estates Infill Area Plan for changes to the road network.

description: The application is for the rezoning of 4261 Cambie Street and 503 West 27th Avenue to a CD-1 District for the purpose of constructing a six-storey residential building. Staff recommend referring the application to Public Hearing with the recommendation to approve it in principle, subject to conditions.

rawSummaries.summary:
CD-1 REZONING: 4261 Cambie Street and 503 West 27th Avenue
Rezone 4261 Cambie Street and 503 West 27th Avenue from RS-1 District to CD-1 District to allow for a six-storey residential building. Proposed height is 21.0 m (69 ft.) with additional height for a rooftop amenity. Proposed floor space ratio (FSR) is 2.80. Applicant: Arno Matis Architecture Inc. Recommended Approval: By the General Manager of Planning, Urban Design and Sustainability, subject to the following conditions: A. Approve the application by Arno Matis Architecture Inc. on behalf of Aria Pacific Cambie Second Development Ltd. to rezone from RS-1 District to CD-1 District. Increase permitted FSR from 0.70 to 2.80 and maximum building height from 10.7 m (35 ft.) to 21 m (69 ft.). Permit development of a six-storey residential building and townhomes with 60 strata-titled units, as presented in the Report. B. Approve the draft CD-1 By-law prepared for the Public Hearing. C. Approve the proposed form of development as prepared by Arno Matis Architecture Inc., with minor alterations allowed by the Director of Planning when approving the detailed scheme of development. Subject to the Conditions of Approval in Appendix B of the Report. D. Amend the Subdivision By-law, as set out in Appendix C of the Report, subject to approval of the CD-1 By-law. E. Passage of the above resolutions creates no legal rights or obligations for the applicant or the City. Any expenditure of funds or costs incurred is at the risk of the person making the expenditure or incurring the cost. F. Approval following the Public Hearing does not obligate the City to enact a rezoning by-law. Costs incurred in fulfilling requirements imposed as a condition of rezoning are at the risk of the property owner. G. The City and its officials, including the Approving Officer, are not limited or directed in the exercise of their authority or discretion, regardless of when they are called upon to exercise such authority or discretion.

CD-1 Rezoning: 4261 Cambie Street and 503 West 27th Avenue
This report evaluates an application to rezone 4261 Cambie Street and 503 West 27th Avenue to a CD-1 District for a six-storey residential building. Staff recommend referring the application to Public Hearing with the recommendation to approve it in principle, subject to conditions.

description: This report evaluates an application to rezone 5079-5161 Ash Street to a CD-1 (Comprehensive Development) District for a six-storey strata-titled residential building. The subject site is zoned RS-1 and located on the west side of Ash Street, at 35th Avenue. The property consists of a four-lot assembly, with a frontage of 75.6 m and a depth of 36.5 m. The total site area is 2,766.7 sq. m and is developed with four single-detached houses. The houses are all rented and the Tenant Relocation and Protection Policy applies. The surrounding area is undergoing significant change, with new four- and six-storey buildings approved or under construction. The portion of the 21-acre Heather Lands project directly across the lane is approved for market strata development with heights from 6 to 18 storeys. The Vancouver Plan and Cambie Corridor Plan support strata buildings up to four storeys and 2.0 FSR. However, increased height to six storeys will be considered for road dedication. A new 35th Avenue road extension is anticipated to connect Queen Elizabeth Park to the Heather Lands. This zoning amendment would allow for a six-storey residential building with 62 strata-titled units. The building would have a height of 21.4 m (70 ft.), a floor area of 5,533.4 sq. m (59,561 sq. ft.), and a floor space ratio (FSR) of 2.0. Ground-level units would face Ash Street, with underground parking accessed from the lane. The southern portion of the site would be dedicated to the City for a new 35th Avenue road extension to the Heather Lands development.

Staff recommend referring the application to Public Hearing with the recommendation to approve it in principle, subject to conditions. The subject site is zoned RS-1 and located on the west side of Ash Street, at 35th Avenue. The property consists of a four-lot assembly, with a frontage of 75.6 m and a depth of 36.5 m. The total site area is 2,766.7 sq. m and is developed with four single-detached houses. The houses are all rented and the Tenant Relocation and Protection Policy applies. The surrounding area is undergoing significant change, with new four- and six-storey buildings approved or under construction. The Vancouver Plan and Cambie Corridor Plan support strata buildings up to four storeys and 2.0 FSR. However, increased height to six storeys will be considered for road dedication. A new 35th Avenue road extension is anticipated to connect Queen Elizabeth Park to the Heather Lands. This zoning amendment would allow for a six-storey residential building with 62 strata-titled units. The building would have a height of 21.4 m (70 ft.), a floor area of 5,533.4 sq. m (59,561 sq. ft.), and a floor space ratio (FSR) of 2.0. description: The application is to rezone 3132-3150 Rosemont Drive to develop a six-storey residential building with 94 social housing units. The subject site is located east of the Rosemont Drive and Kerr Street intersection, with an area of 8,212 sq. m and a frontage of approximately 174 m along Rosemont Drive. The property is currently developed with a two-storey seniors rental building and a two-storey Community Care Facility for seniors, containing 33 units. The proposal addresses priorities within the Housing Vancouver Strategy and aligns with the Vancouver Plan, supporting rezoning for social housing projects and seniors housing close to parks, shopping, and transit.

rawSummaries.summary:
CD-1 REZONING: 3132-3150 Rosemont Drive
To remove 3132-3150 Rosemont Drive from CD-1(72) (Comprehensive Development) District and to rezone the property by creating two new CD-1 (Comprehensive Development) Districts to permit the development of a six-storey residential building with 94 social housing units and retention of the existing community care facility. A height of 20.1 m (66 ft.) and a floor space ratio (FSR) of 2.1 are proposed for the new residential building. A height of 7.3 m (24 ft.) and a floor space ratio (FSR) of 0.67 would be permitted for the retained community care facility, matching the existing development. Applicant: Boni Maddison Architects. Recommended Approval: By the General Manager of Planning, Urban Design and Sustainability, subject to the following conditions as proposed for adoption by resolution of Council: A. THAT the application by Boni Maddison Architects, on behalf of Kopernik Foundation, the registered owner of the lands located at 3132-3150 Rosemont Drive [PID 007-881-002; Lot 44 District Lot 334 Plan 14240], to rezone the lands to remove the property from CD-1 (72) (Comprehensive Development) District and create two new CD-1 (Comprehensive Development) Districts (CD-1 West and CD-1 East) to permit the development of a six-storey residential building with 94 social housing units and retention of the existing community care facility, generally as presented in the Report, be approved in principle; FURTHER THAT the draft CD-1 by-laws, prepared for the Public Hearing in accordance with Appendices A and B of the Report, be approved in principle; FURTHER THAT the proposed form of development also be approved in principle for CD-1 West, generally as prepared by Boni Maddison Architects, received November 16, 2022, provided that the Director of Planning may allow minor alterations to this form of development when approving the detailed scheme of development; FURTHER THAT the above approvals be subject to the Conditions of Approval contained in Appendix D of the Report. B. THAT, subject to the enactment of proposed CD-1 West and CD-1 East by-laws, CD-1 (72) By-law No. 4580, be amended to remove 3132-3150 Rosemont generally as set out in Appendix C of the Report; FURTHER THAT the draft CD-1 (72) by-law amendments, prepared for the Public Hearing in accordance with Appendix C of the Report, be approved in principle. C. THAT subject to approval in principle of the rezoning and the Housing Agreement described in Part 2 of Appendix D of the Report, the Director of Legal Services be instructed to prepare the necessary Housing Agreement By-law for enactment prior to enactment of the by-law for CD-1 West, subject to such terms and conditions as may be required at the discretion of the Director of Legal Services, and the General Manager of Planning, Urban Design and Sustainability. D. THAT Recommendations A to C be adopted on the following conditions: (i) THAT the passage of the above resolutions creates no legal rights for the applicant or any other person, or obligation on the part of the City; and any expenditure of funds or incurring of costs is at the risk of the person making the expenditure or incurring the cost; (ii) THAT any approval that may be granted following the Public Hearing shall not obligate the City to enact a by-law rezoning the property, and any costs incurred in fulfilling requirements imposed as a condition of rezoning are at the risk of the property owner; and (iii) THAT the City and all its officials, including the Approving Officer, shall not in any way be limited or directed in the exercise of their authority or discretion, regardless of when they are called upon to exercise such authority or discretion.

CD-1 Rezoning: 3132-3150 Rosemont Drive
This report evaluates an application to rezone 3132-3150 Rosemont Drive to develop a six-storey residential building with 94 social housing units. Staff recommend referring the application to a Public Hearing with the recommendation to approve it, subject to conditions. The subject site is located east of the Rosemont Drive and Kerr Street intersection, with an area of 8,212 sq. m and a frontage of approximately 174 m along Rosemont Drive. The property is currently developed with a two-storey seniors rental building and a two-storey Community Care Facility for seniors. The rental building contains 33 units, with 21 tenancies eligible for protections under the Tenant Relocation and Protection Policy. The proposal addresses priorities within the Housing Vancouver Strategy which aligns with the Vancouver Plan. The Vision supports rezoning for social housing projects, as well as seniors housing close to parks, shopping and transit.

Staff recommend the application be referred to a Public Hearing with the recommendation to approve it, subject to conditions.

CD-1 Rezoning: 314-328 West Hastings Street
This report evaluates an application to rezone 314-328 West Hastings Street from DD to CD-1. The proposal is for a 12-storey mixed-use building with 128 secured market rental units and at-grade commercial space. Two existing heritage building front facades would be retained and added to the Vancouver Heritage Register. The application meets the intent of the Downtown Eastside Plan and contributes to the City's Housing Vancouver targets. Staff recommend the application be referred to a Public Hearing with the recommendation to approve it, subject to conditions.

description: This report recommends a plan amendment to the Zoning and Development By-law from RS-1 (Residential) District to RR-3A (Residential Rental) District, for the site located at 109 East 40th Avenue. The amendment would allow for a four-storey mixed-use residential building in accordance with the Secured Rental Policy. The subject site is comprised of one legal parcel on the northeast corner of East 40th Avenue and Quebec Street. The site area is approximately 2,653.9 sq. m (28,566 sq. ft.), with a frontage of 70.4 m (231 ft.) along East 40th Avenue and a depth of 37.2 m (122 ft.). The property and the surrounding area are zoned for residential uses under RS and RT District Schedules with the exception of the CD-1 and C-2 areas to the southeast that allows mixed-use development with commercial and residential uses. The site is currently zoned RS-1 and developed with a church constructed in 1956. The property is not listed on the Vancouver Heritage Register. The property contains no rental tenancies and the tenant protection policy does not apply.

description: Rezoning application received for construction of residential multiple-family development and childcare facility at 7388 Southwynde Avenue. Proposal includes six-storey non-market rental building with childcare facility for up to 37 children. The site is located in Sub-Area 3 of the Edmonds Town Centre Plan and is designated for multiple-family residential development under the CD Comprehensive Development District. The P5 Community Institutional District is proposed to be applied to the site for the proposed child care use. Previous related permits include 7488 Southwynde Avenue (constructed in 2003), 7428 Southwynde Avenue (constructed in 2005), 6438 Byrnepark Drive (construction to be completed in 2023), and 7418 Byrne Park Walk (construction completed in 2010). Recommendation is to forward rezoning application to future Public Hearing.

description: Rezoning application received for multiple family development including a non-market rental building, apartment building, and townhouse buildings. The development site is located on the east side of MacPherson Avenue and is designated for medium density multiple-family use. The proposal includes a four-storey non-market rental building with 20 units, a six-storey market strata apartment building with 111 units, and three market strata townhouse buildings with 12 units each, totaling 167 residential dwelling units. The rezoning report proposes to change the site from M2 General Industrial District to CD Comprehensive Development District, using RM3 and RM3r Multiple Family Residential Districts and Royal Oak Community Plan as guidelines.

Recommend forwarding the application to a future Public Hearing. Subject development site located on east side of MacPherson Avenue, designated for medium density multiple-family use. Comprised of two lots. On April 4, 2022, Council received a rezoning report proposing to change the site from M2 General Industrial District to CD Comprehensive Development District, using RM3 and RM3r Multiple Family Residential Districts and Royal Oak Community Plan as guidelines. The proposal includes a four-storey non-market rental building with 20 units, a six-storey market strata apartment building with 111 units, and three market strata townhouse buildings with 12 units each, totaling 167 residential dwelling units.

address: 6645 Dow Ave, 6659 Dow Ave, 6675 Dow Ave, 6691 Dow Ave, 6707 Dow Ave
applicant: Eric Hughes; Dow Beresford Development Limited Partnership
description: Rezoning application received for high-density mixed-use development at the addresses 6645 Dow Ave, 6659 Dow Ave, 6675 Dow Ave, 6691 Dow Ave, and 6707 Dow Ave. The proposed development site consists of five lots and follows guidelines from the RM5s, RM5r, RM4s, and RM4r Districts. The existing rental apartment buildings on the subject properties were built between 1955 and 1964 and have two to three storeys. There are currently 112 rental units across the five sites. The proposed CD Comprehensive Development District zoning includes the RM5r and RM4r Multiple Family Residential Districts to support the replacement of existing rental units and meet the City's Rental Use Zoning Policy requirements.

rawSummaries.summary:
REZ #18-49
REZ #18-49 – 6645 TO 6707 DOW AVE – HIGH DENSITY MIXED-USE DEVELOPMENT. Address: 6645, 6659, 6675, 6691 and 6707 Dow Avenue. Legal: Lot 17 District Lot 153 Group 1 New Westminster District Plan 25187; Lot 4 Block 44 District Lot 153 Group 1 New Westminster District Plan 1212; Lot 5 Block 44 District Lot 153 Group 1 New Westminster District Plan 1212; Lot 6 Block 44 District Lot 153 Group 1 New Westminster District Plan 1212; and Lot 7 Block 44 District Lot 153 Group 1 New Westminster District Plan 1212. Applicant: Eric Hughes; Dow Beresford Development Limited Partnership. Current: RM3 Multiple Family Residential District. Proposed: CD Comprehensive Development District (based on the RM5s, RM5r, RM4s, RM4r Multiple Family Residential Districts, C2 Community Commercial District, C3 General Commercial District and Metrotown Downtown Plan as guidelines, and in accordance with the development plan entitled “6465 Dow Ave” prepared by Boniface Oleksiuk Politano Architects). Recommendations: 1. Prepare and advance a Rezoning Bylaw to First Reading and Public Hearing at a future date of Council. 2. Authorize the introduction of a Housing Agreement Bylaw according to the terms outlined in Section 3.2 of this report, contingent upon Second Reading of the Rezoning Bylaw. 3. Approve an amendment to the Metrotown Downtown Plan as outlined in Section 3.5 of this report, to take effect upon Second Reading of the Rezoning Amendment Bylaw related to the subject site. 4. Establish prerequisites to the completion of the rezoning, including the submission of a suitable plan of development, deposit of sufficient monies, installation of necessary services, undergrounding of existing wiring, consolidation of the net project site, utilization of an amenity bonus, dedication of rights-of-way, granting of necessary statutory rights-of-way, easements and/or covenants, registration of a Housing Agreement and Housing Covenant, submission of a suitable stormwater management system, submission of a Phasing and Construction Management Plan, undertaking to remove all improvements on the development site within 12 months of Final Adoption of the Rezoning Bylaw, and compliance with the City’s Groundwater Management for Multi-Family Development guidelines. 5. Require signage indicating the availability of affordable housing units to be posted at the time of First Reading, or at the time marketing for the subject development commences, and remain posted for a period of one year, or until all units are sold. Chief Administrative Officer’s Comments: Concur with the recommendation of the General Manager Planning and Development. Executive Summary: Rezoning application received for high-density mixed-use development. Recommend forwarding application to future Public Hearing. Policy Section: Proposed rezoning application consistent with various policies and plans adopted by Council. Background: Subject development site located in Maywood neighbourhood of Metrotown Downtown Plan area. Plan identifies neighbourhood as residential "heart" of Metrotown with high-density multiple-family development. Subject properties designated for high-density mixed-use development under Comprehensive Development District. The development proposal aligns with permitted C2 commercial densities. The rationale for including the C3 General Commercial District as guidelines is explained in Section 3.5. On April 27, 2020, Council received a rezoning report for the four properties (6645, 6659, 6675, and 6691 Dow Avenue) in line with the adopted Plan. Council authorized staff to work with the applicant to create a suitable development plan. On October 25, 2021, Staff provided an expanded site report to Council, informing them of the applicant's intention to revise their original proposal to include the property at 6707 Dow Avenue. This property is designated for high-density multiple family residential development in the adopted Metrotown Downtown Plan. Council authorized staff to continue working with the applicant to develop a plan that includes this additional property. The proposed development site consists of five lots and follows guidelines from the RM5s, RM5r, RM4s, and RM4r Districts. The maximum permitted density for the redevelopment of the subject site is calculated based on the proportions of the different residential designations on the consolidated site. The existing rental apartment buildings on the subject properties were built between 1955 and 1964 and have two to three storeys. There are currently 112 rental units across the five sites. Vehicular access to 6645 Dow Avenue is from a rear lane, while access to the other four properties is from Dow Avenue. The proposed CD Comprehensive Development District zoning includes the RM5r and RM4r Multiple Family Residential Districts to support the replacement of existing rental units and meet the City's Rental Use Zoning Policy requirements.

description: Sian Group Investments Inc. has applied on behalf of the owner, 1199445 BC Ltd. (Sukhinder Kaur Sian), to rezone 7100 and 7120 Ash Street from the “Single Detached (RS1/F)” zone to the “Town Housing (ZT16) - South McLennan and St. Albans Sub-Area (City Centre)” zone to permit the development of 17 townhouses. The original application by the previous owner was considered and the rezoning bylaw was granted third reading at the Public Hearing on May 19, 2020. The current owner purchased the property in 2021 and has made progress with several aspects of the proposal, including tree retention and replacement, obtaining a T3 Tree Removal Permit, advancing the design of required servicing and off-site improvements, and advancing the Development Permit (DP) application to the Development Permit Panel on September 14, 2022. The applicant is seeking to remove four trees and plant an additional eight trees on-site, consistent with the 2:1 replacement ratio in the OCP. The $40,000.00 tree survival security originally associated with retention of the four on-site trees is no longer required, and the eight additional replacement trees will be accounted for in the landscaping security associated with the Landscape Plan that forms part of the Development Permit.

description: Maskeen (Hamilton) Properties Corp. has applied to rezone the specified properties at 4651, 4671, 4691 Smith Crescent, 23301, 23321, 23361, and 23381 Gilley Road from the “Single Detached (RS1/F)” Zone to the “Residential/Limited Commercial (ZMU53) – Neighbourhood Village Centre (Hamilton)” Zone. The proposal includes a mixed-use mid-rise development with 186 dwelling units, a mix of strata units and Low-End Market Rental units, as well as commercial space and City-owned community amenity space. Amendments to the Hamilton Area Plan and City's Official Community Plan are associated with the application.

rawSummaries.summary:
RZ 21-942276
Maskeen (Hamilton) Properties Corp. has applied to rezone the site at 4651, 4671, 4691 Smith Crescent, 23301, 23321, 23361, and 23381 Gilley Road from the “Single Detached (RS1/F)” zone to a new “Residential/Limited Commercial (ZMU53) – Neighbourhood Village Centre (Hamilton)” site-specific zone. The proposal includes the development of a mixed-use mid-rise development with 186 dwelling units, including 167 strata units and 19 Low-End Market Rental (LEMR) units. It also involves the construction of a Community Policing Office to be transferred to the City. The proposal consists of one five-storey mixed-use building, one four-storey apartment building, and one two-storey amenity building atop a common parkade, with a total floor area of approximately 15,661 m2 (168,569 ft2). The proposal also includes approximately 130 m2 (1,400 ft2) of City-owned community amenity space and approximately 603.9 m2 (6,500 ft2) of commercial space fronting onto Gilley Road. The rezoning application is associated with amendments to the Hamilton Area Plan and City’s Official Community Plan (OCP) City of Richmond 2041 OCP Land Use Map.

description: The application is for the rezoning of 9671 No. 1 Road from 'Single Detached (RS1/E)' Zone to 'Compact Single Detached (RC2)' Zone. The purpose is to subdivide the property to create two single-family lots, each with vehicle access from the rear lane. The existing unoccupied single-family dwelling on the property is proposed to be demolished. The proposed rezoning and subdivision are consistent with the Official Community Plan (OCP) and the Arterial Road Land Use Policy. Prior to final adoption of the rezoning bylaw, a Landscape Plan must be submitted and the requirements of the Richmond Flood Plain Designation and Protection Bylaw 8204 must be met. Public consultation will be provided as per the Local Government Act and the City's Zoning Bylaw 8500. Vehicular access to No. 1 Road is not permitted and will be restricted to the rear lane only.

description: Fougere Architecture Inc. has applied to rezone 7371 No. 4 Road from the 'Single Detached (RS1/F)' zone to the 'Medium Density Townhouses (RTM2)' zone. The proposal is to develop 19 townhouse units including two secondary suites, with vehicle access from General Currie Road. The existing site consists of a large lot with a single-family dwelling that is proposed to be demolished. Surrounding developments include single-family dwellings, townhouse units, and lots zoned for agriculture. There are also existing legal encumbrances such as a Statutory Right-of-Way and a cross-access easement. The proposal is consistent with the Official Community Plan and the McLennan South Sub-Area Plan, and includes contributions to the Public Art Reserve Fund and Affordable Housing Reserve Fund. The proposal deviates from the minimum frontage width and site area requirements, but it is demonstrated that the policy and design objectives of the Plan are not compromised, and the proposal provides recognizable benefits to the area such as tree retention and an enhanced pedestrian environment.

description: The proposed rezoning application is for the consolidated site at 4330 Kingsway to the amended CD Comprehensive Development District, using the RM5s and RM5r Multiple Family Residential Districts, and the C3 General Commercial District as guidelines. The purpose is to permit the renovation of the two existing commercial office buildings on the site, including recladding, alterations to the site’s public realm and landscaping, and the addition of floor area. The revised proposal includes the property at 4370 Kingsway, expanding the subject site to cover the entire block bounded by Kingsway, Kathleen Avenue, Kemp Street, and Wilson Avenue. The revised proposal would replace the existing 10-storey commercial office building at the southeast corner of the site with a high-density mixed-use building comprised of both market and non-market dwelling units, and street-activating retail uses. The existing 19-storey commercial office building on the northwest corner of the site will be retained and re-cladded.

rawSummaries.summary:
REZ #19-07
REZ #19-07 – 4330 Kingsway – Expanded Site Proposal. The proposed rezoning application is to rezone the consolidated site at 4330 Kingsway to the amended CD Comprehensive Development District (using the RM5s and RM5r Multiple Family Residential Districts, and the C3 General Commercial District as guidelines). The initial purpose of the rezoning application was to permit the renovation of the two existing commercial office buildings on the site, including recladding, alterations to the site’s public realm and landscaping, and the addition of floor area. The proposal received Second and Third Reading from Council on August 24, 2020 and June 28, 2021, on the basis that it supports the retention of employment opportunities in the Metrotown area. The revised proposal includes the property at 4370 Kingsway, expanding the subject site to cover the entire block bounded by Kingsway, Kathleen Avenue, Kemp Street, and Wilson Avenue. The revised proposal would replace the existing 10-storey commercial office building at the southeast corner of the site with a high-density mixed-use building comprised of both market and non-market dwelling units, and street-activating retail uses. The existing 19-storey commercial office building on the northwest corner of the site will be retained and re-cladded.

description: The report recommends a plan amendment to rezone the site at 2325-2377 West 49th Avenue from RS-5 District to RR-2B District for a five-storey market rental building. The application meets the requirements of the Secured Rental Policy. Staff recommend referring the application to a Public Hearing with approval in principle and conditions.

rawSummaries.summary:
Rezoning: 2325-2377 W 49th Avenue
Rezone 2325-2377 West 49th Avenue from RS-5 (Residential) District to RR-2B (Residential) District for a five-storey market rental building. Proposed height: 16.8 m (55 ft.), Proposed FSR: 2.40. Applicant: Intracorp Homes. Referral: Report titled 'Rezoning: 2325-2377 West 49th Avenue', dated April 25, 2023, referred to Public Hearing on May 9, 2023. Recommended Approval: By the General Manager of Planning, Urban Design and Sustainability, subject to conditions proposed in the Report. A. Approve the application by Intracorp Homes on behalf of Westward Development Nominee Inc. to rezone the lands from RS-5 (Residential) District to RR-2B (Residential Rental) District as presented in the Report. B. Instruct the Director of Legal Services to prepare the necessary Housing Agreement By-law for enactment prior to the zoning amendment by-law, subject to terms and conditions required by the Director of Legal Services and the General Manager of Planning, Urban Design and Sustainability. C. Amend the Subdivision By-law as set out in Appendix C of the Report, subject to approval of the zoning amendment by-law. D. Adopt Recommendations A to C with the following conditions: (i) Passage of the resolutions creates no legal rights or obligations for the applicant or the City. Any expenditure of funds or costs incurred are at the risk of the person making the expenditure or incurring the cost. (ii) Approval following the public hearing does not obligate the City to enact a rezoning by-law. Costs incurred for rezoning requirements are at the risk of the property owner. (iii) The City and its officials retain full authority and discretion in the exercise of their duties.

Rezoning: 2325-2377 West 49th Avenue - RTS 15697
This report recommends a plan amendment to rezone the site at 2325-2377 West 49th Avenue from RS-5 District to RR-2B District for a five-storey market rental building. The application meets the requirements of the Secured Rental Policy. Staff recommend referring the application to a Public Hearing with approval in principle and conditions.

description: The rezoning application is for the lands located at 3803-3823 West 10th Avenue. The proposal is to rezone the lands from RS-1 to RR-3B District, allowing for the development of a six-storey mixed-use rental building with 20% of the residential floor area designated as below-market rental units. The site is currently zoned RS-1 and consists of three single-detached homes. The proposed development is in line with the new residential rental zoning district approved by the Council in December 2021, permitting mixed-use residential buildings up to six storeys in height and 3.4 FSR. The recommendations for the rezoning application are subject to certain conditions.

rawSummaries.summary:
Rezoning: 3803-3823 West 10th Avenue
Rezone 3803-3823 West 10th Avenue from RS-1 (Residential) District to RR-3B (Residential Rental) District. Allow for a six-storey mixed-use market rental building with commercial retail at grade. 20% of residential floor area secured as below-market rental units. Proposed height of 22.0 m (72 ft.) and floor space ratio (FSR) of 3.50. Applicant: Sightline Properties (Highbury Street) Ltd. Referral: Relates to the report entitled 'Rezoning: 3803-3823 West 10th Avenue', dated April 25, 2023. Referred to Public Hearing at the Council Meeting of May 9, 2022. Recommended Approval: By the General Manager of Planning, Urban Design and Sustainability, subject to conditions proposed for adoption by resolution of Council. A. Approve in principle the application by Sightline Properties (Highbury Street) Ltd. to rezone the lands from RS-1 to RR-3B District, generally as presented in the Report. B. Instruct the Director of Legal Services to prepare the necessary Housing Agreement By-law for enactment prior to the zoning amendment By-law, subject to approval in principle of the rezoning and the Housing Agreement described in Part 2 of Appendix B of the Report. C. Amend the Subdivision By-law generally as set out in Appendix C of the Report, subject to approval of the zoning amendment By-law. D. Adopt Recommendations A to C on the following conditions: (i) Passage of the resolutions creates no legal rights or obligations for the applicant or the City. Any expenditure of funds or costs incurred are at the risk of the person making the expenditure or incurring the cost. (ii) Approval following the public hearing does not obligate the City to enact a rezoning by-law. Costs incurred in fulfilling rezoning requirements are at the risk of the property owner. (iii) The City and its officials, including the Approving Officer, are not limited or directed in the exercise of their authority or discretion, regardless of when they are called upon to exercise such authority or discretion.

Rezoning Application for 3803-3823 West 10th Avenue
The recommendation is to refer the rezoning application for 3803-3823 West 10th Avenue to a Public Hearing and to approve the application in principle. The application is to rezone the lands from RS-1 to RR-3B District, allowing for a six-storey mixed-use rental building with 20% of the residential floor area as below-market rental units. The Council has made previous decisions related to this rezoning. The subject site is located at the corner of West 10th Avenue and Highbury Street and is currently zoned RS-1 and developed with three single-detached homes. In December 2021, Council approved the addition of RR-3B as a new residential rental zoning district, permitting mixed-use residential buildings up to six-storeys in height and 3.4 FSR. The recommendations are subject to certain conditions.

description: The application is for the rezoning of 427-449 West 39th Avenue to a CD-1 District. The proposal is for an 18-storey building with 176 secured-rental units, including below-market rental units. The proposal aligns with the Cambie Corridor Plan. Staff recommend referring the application to a Public Hearing with the recommendation to approve it in principle, subject to conditions.

rawSummaries.summary:
CD-1 REZONING: 427-449 West 39th Avenue
Rezone 427-449 West 39th Avenue from RS-1 District to CD-1 District. Allow an 18-storey secured-market rental building with 176 rental units, including 20% below-market rental units. Proposed building height: 55m. Proposed floor space ratio: 6.10. Applicant: Gracorp Properties Ltd. Recommended Approval: By the General Manager of Planning, Urban Design and Sustainability, subject to conditions proposed by Council. A. Approve the application by Gracorp Properties Ltd. to rezone the lands from RS-1 District to CD-1 District. Increase floor space ratio from 0.70 to 6.10 and building height from 10.7m to 55m. Permit the development of an 18-storey building with 176 secured-rental units, including 20% below-market rental units. Approve the proposed form of development. B. Instruct the Director of Legal Services to prepare the necessary Housing Agreement By-law for enactment prior to the zoning amendment By-law. C. Amend the Subdivision By-law, subject to approval of the CD-1 By-law. Instruct the Director of Legal Services to bring forward the amendment to the Subdivision By-law at the time of enactment of the CD-1 By-law. D. Adopt Recommendations A to C with the following conditions: (i) Passage of resolutions creates no legal rights or obligations for the applicant or the City. Any expenditure of funds or costs is at the risk of the person making the expenditure. (ii) Approval following the Public Hearing does not obligate the City to enact a rezoning by-law. Costs incurred for rezoning requirements are at the risk of the property owner. (iii) City officials have full authority and discretion in their actions.

CD-1 Rezoning: 427-449 West 39th Avenue
This report evaluates an application to rezone 427-449 West 39th Avenue to a CD-1 District. The proposal is for an 18-storey building with 176 secured-rental units, including below-market rental units. The proposal is consistent with the Cambie Corridor Plan. Staff recommend referring the application to a Public Hearing with the recommendation to approve it in principle, subject to conditions.

7919-0177-00

PURPOSE: The applicant is requesting to amend Official Community Plan (OCP) Table 7A: Land Use Designation Exemptions by adding site specific permission for the subject site to permit a density up to 2.7 FAR within the 'Multiple Residential' designation. The proposal also includes rezoning the same site from Single Family Residential Zone and Duplex Residential Zone to Comprehensive Development Zone in order to develop three, 6-storey apartment buildings, containing 319 dwelling units, over a shared two-level underground parkade, in City Centre.

The Notice of the Public Hearing was read by the City Clerk.

D. Jack, Surrey Environmental Partners: The delegation spoke in opposition to the proposal citing trees, health, and well-being.

Written submissions were received as follows:

• R. Landale expressing opposition for the proposal citing trees, transportation, traffic, and parking.

description: Landa Oval Development Ltd. has applied to rezone 6851 and 6871 Elmbridge Way from “Light Industrial Business Park (IB1)” to “High Density Mixed Use (ZMU52) – Oval Village (City Centre)” to construct a mixed use development. The proposed project consists of 13,826 m2 of commercial floor area including a 189 room hotel and supporting uses, as well as 27,652 m2 of residential floor area consisting of 321 market residential units and 35 affordable Low End Market Rental (LEMR) housing units. Transportation related infrastructure and works include dedication and construction of a new west road, lane widening and upgrades, and frontage upgrades along River Road and Elmbridge Way. Proposed revisions to the project include relocating hotel pick-up and drop-off functions, installing a gate with access control measures for lane access, and providing loading, servicing functions, and a hotel shuttle parking with passenger loading area in dedicated areas on-site to address traffic concerns and improve overall traffic flow and safety in the area.

rawSummaries.summary:
RZ 17-782750
Landa Oval Development Ltd. has applied to the City of Richmond to rezone 6851 and 6871 Elmbridge Way from “Light Industrial Business Park (IB1)” to “High Density Mixed Use (ZMU52) – Oval Village (City Centre)” to construct a mixed use development in the Oval Village area. First reading to Richmond Zoning Bylaw 8500, Amendment Bylaw 10423, was granted on November 14, 2022 and was referred to a Public Hearing. At the December 19, 2022 Public Hearing, Council made the following referral: That the staff report titled “Application by Landa Oval Development Ltd. for Rezoning at 6851 and 6871 Elmbridge Way from Industrial Business Park (1B1) to High Density Mixed Use (ZMU52) - Oval Village (City Centre)”, dated October 24, 2022, from the Director, Development, be referred back to staff for further review. The purpose of this report is to respond to the Public Hearing referral and present changes to the proposed development along with related information in response to the traffic concerns raised. Revised rezoning considerations are included to facilitate these changes should they be supported by Council. Findings of Fact: 13,826 m2 (148,822 ft2) of commercial floor area consisting of 189 room hotel and supporting uses in the podium and tower, located in the north east quadrant of the development site fronting River Road, with remaining at-grade commercial space along the new road (herein called the new west road) and Elmbridge Way. 27,652 m2 (297,644 ft2) of residential floor area consisting of 321 market residential units and 35 affordable Low End Market Rental (LEMR) housing units. The market residential units will be situated in the project podium and two residential towers located at the north west and south west corners of the development site. The LEMR housing units will be dispersed throughout the project podium. Transportation related infrastructure and works includes: Dedication and construction of the new west road along the subject site’s entire west frontage with one primary vehicle access from the new west road; Lane widening and upgrades along the subject site’s entire east frontage with one vehicle access (restricted) from the lane; and Frontage upgrades along the River Road and Elmbridge Way consistent with current City standards and existing improvements completed in the surrounding area.

RZ 17-782750
Landa Oval Development Ltd. has applied to the City of Richmond to rezone 6851 and 6871 Elmbridge Way from “Light Industrial Business Park (IB1)” to “High Density Mixed Use (ZMU52) – Oval Village (City Centre)” to construct a mixed use development in the Oval Village area. First reading to Richmond Zoning Bylaw 8500, Amendment Bylaw 10423, was granted on November 14, 2022 and was referred to a Public Hearing. The proposed project consists of 13,826 m2 (148,822 ft2) of commercial floor area consisting of 189 room hotel and supporting uses in the podium and tower, located in the northeast quadrant of the development site fronting River Road, with remaining at-grade commercial space along the new road (herein called the new west road) and Elmbridge Way. 27,652 m2 (297,644 ft2) of residential floor area consisting of 321 market residential units and 35 affordable Low End Market Rental (LEMR) housing units. Transportation related infrastructure and works includes: Dedication and construction of the new west road along the subject site’s entire west frontage with one primary vehicle access from the new west road; Lane widening and upgrades along the subject site’s entire east frontage with one vehicle access (restricted) from the lane; and Frontage upgrades along the River Road and Elmbridge Way consistent with current City standards and existing improvements completed in the surrounding area. The purpose of the report is to respond to the Public Hearing referral and present changes to the proposed development along with related information in response to the traffic concerns raised. The developer's project team undertook outreach with Ora strata council members, surrounding businesses, and Ora commercial tenants to address traffic concerns. Proposed revisions to the project include relocating hotel pick-up and drop-off functions, installing a gate with access control measures for lane access, and providing loading, servicing functions, and a hotel shuttle parking with passenger loading area in dedicated areas on-site to address traffic concerns and improve overall traffic flow and safety in the area.

Application by 1265028 B.C. Ltd. for Rezoning at 8180 Heather Street from 'Single Detached (RS1/E)' Zone to the 'Single Detached (RS2/A)' Zone. The owner has applied to the City of Richmond for permission to rezone 8180 Heather Street to permit the property to be subdivided into two single-family lots with the western lot accessed from Heather Street and the eastern lot accessed from Dixon Avenue. The proposed subdivision plan is included in the report. The existing single-family dwelling on the subject property is proposed to be demolished. The surrounding development includes single-family dwellings zoned 'Single Detached (RS2/A)' to the North, 'Single Detached (RS1/B)' across Dixon Avenue to the South, and 'Single Detached (RS1/E)' to the East. The proposed rezoning and subdivision is consistent with the Official Community Plan and the Broadmoor Area – Ash Street Sub-Area Plan. The proposed redevelopment must meet the requirements of the Richmond Flood Plain Designation and Protection Bylaw 8204. Public consultation has been conducted, and the Planning Committee will endorse the application and Council will grant first reading to the rezoning bylaw, which will then be forwarded to a Public Hearing.

description: Ajit Aujla and New Villa Holdings have applied to rezone 8491 No. 4 Road from the 'Single Detached (RS1/E)' zone to a new site-specific zone, 'Coach House (ZS31) - No. 4 Road'. The proposed rezoning would permit the property to be subdivided to create two lots, each with a principal dwelling and an accessory coach house above a detached garage, with vehicle access from the existing rear lane. The proposed site-specific zone is identical in all provisions to the standard 'Coach Houses (RCH1)' zone, but allows for a reduced lot depth. The existing single-family dwelling on the property is proposed to be demolished. The surrounding development consists of single-family dwellings on lots zoned 'Single Detached (RS1/E)' and 'Compact Single Detached (RC1)' fronting No. 4 Road, as well as single-family dwellings on agricultural lots included in the Agricultural Land Reserve (ALR), zoned 'Agriculture (AG1)'. The proposal is consistent with the Official Community Plan (OCP) land use designation for the subject site and the Arterial Road Land Use Policy. The applicant is required to register a legal agreement on Title to ensure that a 4.0 m wide landscaped Agricultural Land Reserve (ALR) buffer along No. 4 Road is maintained and will not be abandoned or removed, and to meet the requirements of the Richmond Flood Plain Designation and Protection Bylaw 8204.

description: The application is for a LAP Amendment from 'Single Family Residential (6 u.p.a.)' to 'Single Family Small Lots' and Rezoning from RF to RF-SD to allow subdivision into 4 lots at 1483 King George Boulevard. The owners are A. Syed and R. Jamal, and the agent is H.Y. Engineering Ltd. (Daniel Hanhausen). The decision is to introduce a Bylaw to rezone the subject site from 'Single Family Residential Zone (RF)' to 'Semi-Detached Residential Zone (RF-SD)' and to set a date for Public Hearing.

7922-0169-00
CIVIC ADDRESS: 1483 King George Boulevard

APPLICANT: Owners: A. Syed, R. Jamal
Agent: H.Y. Engineering Ltd. (Daniel Hanhausen)

PURPOSE: The applicant is requesting to rezone the site from Single Family Residential Zone to Semi-Detached Residential Zone in order to subdivide the subject site into four lots.

The proposal was met with opposition from several delegations citing concerns about access, density, parking, pedestrian safety, alleyway parking, traffic, parking, character of the neighborhood, trees, congestion, sewer system, aging electrical transformers, and road safety. Written submissions expressing opposition and concerns were also received.

description: OCP Text Amendment to allow a higher density in the 'Multiple Residential' designation. Rezoning from RF to CD (based on RM-70). 7922-0223-00
CIVIC ADDRESS: 14518, 14528, 14538, and 14548 - 104A Avenue

APPLICANT: Owner: 1287870 B.C. Ltd. (Director Information: Kulwant Dhesi, Aman Dhillon, Petrit Humolli, Charnjeev Makkar) Agent: David Eaton Architect Inc. (Manpreet Singh)

PURPOSE: The applicant is requesting to amend the Official Community Plan (OCP), Table 7A: Land Use Designation Exceptions by adding site specific permission to permit a density up to 2.35 FAR within the 'Multiple Residential' designation. The proposal also includes rezoning the site from Single Family Residential Zone to Comprehensive Development Zone in order to develop a 6-storey apartment building with approximately 152 dwelling units and underground parking on a consolidated site in Guildford.

The Notice of the Public Hearing was read by the Deputy City Clerk.

M. Gruber, David Eaton Architects (Architect on behalf of the Applicant): The Architect spoke to the construction of a new street.

Written submissions were received as follows:
• J. Heo expressing opposition for the proposal citing noise, privacy and decrease in property value.
• R. Landale expressing opposition for the proposal citing trees, traffic, road and density.
• R. Howe expressing concerns for the proposal citing quality of life, traffic, parking, congestion, sidewalks, water and electrical.

description: The application is for a rezoning from RM-70 to CD and a Development Variance Permit to allow for a small-scale drug store within an existing residential development. The owner, Habitat Housing Society, is applying for this development. The agent, JSK Healthcare Limited (Healthcare Pharmacy) represented by Krupen Shah, is involved in the application. The proposed development includes a small-scale drug store at 13352 Old Yale Road. The Development Variance Permit No. 7923-0021-00 is to vary the minimum separation distance between the lot lines of drug stores from 400 metres to 30 metres to permit the small-scale drug store at the specified address.

description: The application is for the rezoning of 1045 Burnaby Street to a CD-1 District. The proposal is for a 16-storey residential building with secured-market rental units and below-market rental units. The application aligns with the West End Community Plan and Criteria for Secured Rental Housing. Staff recommend referring the application to a Public Hearing with the recommendation to approve it, subject to conditions.

rawSummaries.summary:
CD-1 REZONING: 1045 Burnaby Street
Rezone 1045 Burnaby Street from RM-5A to CD-1 to develop a 16-storey residential building with 170 secured-rental housing units, including 133 market rental and 37 below-market rental units. Proposed height is 49.0 m and floor space ratio is 6.19. Applicant: Gracorp Properties Ltd. Referral: Report titled 'CD-1 Rezoning: 1045 Burnaby Street' dated March 14, 2023, referred to Public Hearing on March 28, 2023. Recommended Approval: By the General Manager of Planning, Urban Design and Sustainability, subject to conditions proposed for adoption by resolution of Council. A. Approve the application by Gracorp Properties Ltd. to rezone the lands from RM-5A to CD-1, allowing for the development of a 16-storey residential building with a maximum height of 49.0 m and a floor space ratio of 6.19. The building will have 133 secured-market rental units and 37 below-market rental units. B. Instruct the Director of Legal Services to prepare the necessary Housing Agreement By-law, subject to approval of the rezoning and the Housing Agreement described in Part 2 of Appendix B of the Report. C. Adopt Recommendations A and B with the following conditions: (i) Passage of the resolutions creates no legal rights or obligations for the applicant or the City. (ii) Approval following the Public Hearing does not obligate the City to enact a rezoning by-law, and any costs incurred are at the risk of the property owner. (iii) City officials have full authority and discretion in their actions. Approvals are subject to the Conditions of Approval in Appendix B of the Report.

CD-1 Rezoning: 1045 Burnaby Street
This report evaluates an application to rezone 1045 Burnaby Street to a CD-1 District. The proposal includes a 16-storey residential building with secured-market rental units and below-market rental units. The application meets the West End Community Plan and Criteria for Secured Rental Housing. Staff recommend referring the application to a Public Hearing with the recommendation to approve it, subject to conditions.

description: This is a rezoning application for 4065 Victoria Drive to permit a three-storey replacement and expansion of the Cedar Cottage Neighbourhood House. The proposal includes a 37-space childcare facility, adult daycare facility, multi-purpose community spaces, administrative, and support spaces. The maximum height of the building is 13.9 m (46 ft.), with a total floor area of 1,934 sq. m (20,807 sq. ft.), and a density of 1.41 FSR proposed. Additionally, there will be one level of underground parking accessed from Alice Street, and a portion of Alice Street adjacent to the application site is proposed to be leased for use as part of the outdoor play space for the childcare facility.

rawSummaries.summary:
CD-1 REZONING: 4065 Victoria Drive
Rezone 4065 Victoria Drive from RS-1A District to CD-1 District for a three-storey replacement and expansion of Cedar Cottage Neighbourhood House. Proposed height: 13.9 m, proposed FSR: 1.41. Applicant: DA Architects + Planners. Referral: Report titled 'CD-1 Rezoning: 4065 Victoria Drive (Cedar Cottage Neighbourhood House)', dated March 14, 2023, referred to Public Hearing on March 28, 2023. Recommended Approval: By General Manager of Planning, Urban Design and Sustainability, subject to conditions proposed by Council. A. Approve rezoning of 4065 Victoria Drive from RS-1A District to CD-1 District to increase FSR from 0.60 to 1.41 and building height from 10.7 m to 13.9 m for a three-storey replacement of Cedar Cottage Neighbourhood House, as presented in the Report. B. Adopt Recommendation A with conditions: (i) Passage of resolutions creates no legal rights or obligations for the applicant or the City. (ii) Approval following Public Hearing does not obligate the City to enact a rezoning by-law, and costs incurred for rezoning requirements are at the property owner's risk. (iii) City officials have full authority and discretion in exercising their powers.

CD-1 Rezoning: 4065 Victoria Drive (Cedar Cottage Neighbourhood House)
This report evaluates an application to rezone 4065 Victoria Drive to CD-1 District to permit a three-storey replacement and expansion of the Cedar Cottage Neighbourhood House. Staff recommend referring the application to a Public Hearing with the recommendation to approve it in principle, subject to conditions. The rezoning proposal would permit a three-storey replacement and expansion of the Cedar Cottage Neighbourhood House, which is a non-profit-owned facility. The proposal includes a 37-space childcare facility, adult daycare facility, multi-purpose community spaces, administrative, and support spaces. Multi-purpose community spaces for small and medium-sized group activities, administrative and support spaces on levels two and three, owned and operated by the Neighbourhood House. Maximum height of 13.9 m (46 ft.), total floor area of 1,934 sq. m (20,807 sq. ft.), and density of 1.41 FSR proposed. One level of underground parking accessed from Alice Street. Portion of Alice Street adjacent to application site, between property line and sidewalk, proposed to be leased for use as part of outdoor play space for childcare facility.

description: The development in question is a plan amendment to rezone the site at 657-685 East 18th Avenue from RS-1 District to RR-2A District in accordance with the Secured Rental Policy. The total site area is approximately 1,118 sq. m (12,034 sq. ft.) with a frontage of 30 m (98.4 ft.) along East 18th Avenue and a depth of 37.5 m (123 ft.). The proposed development complies with the location criteria under SRP for four-storey buildings. The addition of new residential rental zoning district schedules to the Zoning & Development By-law; RR-1, RR-2A, RR-2B, RR-2C, and RR-3A and RR-3B was approved by the Council in December 2021. All residential uses in the RR zones are secured as rental tenure, and no stratification or sale of individual residential units is allowed. The development aims to support new missing middle buildings that foster neighbourliness and social connection and contribute to an evolving streetscape which accommodates more architectural variety and diversity of housing options.

Recommended Approval: By General Manager of Planning, Urban Design and Sustainability, subject to conditions proposed for adoption by Council resolution. A. Approve application by OrrMoniz Projects Corp. to rezone the lands from RS-1 District to RR-2A District as presented in the Report. B. Instruct Director of Legal Services to prepare necessary Housing Agreement By-law for enactment prior to zoning amendment by-law. C. Amend Subdivision By-law as set out in Appendix C of the Report. D. Adopt Recommendations A to C with specified conditions. (i) Passage of resolutions creates no legal rights or obligations for the applicant or City. (ii) Approval following Public Hearing does not obligate City to enact rezoning by-law, and costs incurred for rezoning requirements are at property owner's risk. (iii) City and officials retain authority and discretion in exercise of their duties.

Rezoning: 657-685 East 18th Avenue - RTS 15571
This report recommends a plan amendment to rezone the site at 657-685 East 18th Avenue from RS-1 District to RR-2A District in accordance with the Secured Rental Policy. Staff recommend referring the application to a Public Hearing with the recommendation to approve it in principle, subject to conditions. The subject site is comprised of three legal parcels fronting East 18th Avenue. The total site area is approximately 1,118 sq. m (12,034 sq. ft.) with a frontage of 30 m (98.4 ft.) along East 18th Avenue and a depth of 37.5 m (123 ft.). The SRP generally supports up to four-storey mixed-use and five-storey residential apartments on arterials, and up to four-storey townhouses or apartments on sites off arterials. Up to six storeys may be considered for projects on arterials where the residential component includes a minimum 20% permanently secured below-market rental housing or 100% social housing. This application complies with the location criteria under SRP for four-storey buildings. In December 2021, Council approved the addition of new residential rental ("RR") zoning district schedules to the Zoning & Development By-law; RR-1, RR-2A, RR-2B and RR-2C, and RR-3A and RR-3B. All residential uses in the RR zones are secured as rental tenure, and no stratification or sale of individual residential units is allowed. Further direction on form of development expectations under each of the RR zones is provided in the Residential Rental Districts Schedules Design Guidelines. The guidelines support new missing middle buildings that foster neighbourliness and social connection and contribute to an evolving streetscape which accommodates more architectural variety and diversity of housing options.

description: The proposed rezoning bylaw amendment is to establish a Conceptual Master Plan and Design Guidelines for the Buchanan West Site, which is approximately 10.68 acres in size and is comprised of seven individual parcels. The plan is to guide further site specific rezoning applications for the future construction of high-density strata, rental, commercial retail, office, and hospitality development over time. The owner of 4265 Lougheed Highway, First Capital, is the applicant for the Conceptual Master Plan and associated Community Plan Amendment. The remaining parcels within the subject site are currently held by separate owners, with the exception of 1934 Gilmore Avenue and 4129 Lougheed Highway, which are under common ownership. The proposed rezoning application is consistent with various strategic plans and policies. The amendment to the Brentwood Town Centre Development Plan is recommended to be approved, to take effect upon the granting by Council of Second Reading of the Rezoning Bylaw related to the subject site. A Rezoning Bylaw is recommended to be prepared and advanced to First Reading on February 27, 2023, and to a Public Hearing on March 28, 2023 at 5:00 p.m. The submission of a suitable plan of development is established as a prerequisite to the completion of the rezoning.

No specific development is being proposed by the subject rezoning application

REZ #19-35, Buchanan West Conceptual Master Plan
The proposed rezoning bylaw amendment is to establish a Conceptual Master Plan and Design Guidelines for the Buchanan West Site, in order to guide further site specific rezoning applications for the future construction of high-density strata, rental, commercial retail, office, and hospitality development over time. No specific development is being proposed by the subject rezoning application. The proposed rezoning application is consistent with the Corporate Strategic Plan (2022), Regional Context Statement (2013), Official Community Plan (1998), Brentwood Town Centre Development Plan (1996), Economic Development Strategy (2007), Social Sustainability Strategy (2011), Environmental Sustainability Strategy (2016), Climate Action Framework (2020), Transportation Plan (2021), Home Strategy (2021), and Rental Use Zoning Policy (2020). The Buchanan West Site is approximately 10.68 acres (465,146 sq. ft.) in size and is comprised of seven individual parcels. One of the parcels (1934 Gilmore Avenue) is vacant, one parcel (4201 Lougheed Highway) is occupied by a hotel, and the remaining parcels (4129, 4141, 4199, 4219, and 4265 Lougheed Highway) are occupied by older low-rise commercial buildings. The applicant for the Conceptual Master Plan and associated Community Plan Amendment, First Capital, is the owner of 4265 Lougheed Highway. The remaining parcels within the subject site are currently held by separate owners, with the exception of 1934 Gilmore Avenue and 4129 Lougheed Highway, which are under common ownership. The amendment to the Brentwood Town Centre Development Plan, as outlined in Section 5.0 of this report, is recommended to be approved, to take effect upon the granting by Council of Second Reading of the Rezoning Bylaw related to the subject site. A Rezoning Bylaw is recommended to be prepared and advanced to First Reading on February 27, 2023, and to a Public Hearing on March 28, 2023 at 5:00 p.m. The submission of a suitable plan of development is established as a prerequisite to the completion of the rezoning. A copy of this report will be sent to the property owners of 4129, 4141, 4199, 4201, 4219 Lougheed Highway, and 1934 Gilmore Avenue.
